input: Idaho has many lovely qualities. It has great vistas, wonderful fishing, and potatoes (Famous Potatoes, in point of fact). But it also is filled with people who want to kill OR-7, and his other OR and non
continuation:
-human enemies.   That said, if I were a baddie, I would love to live in Idaho. I'm a fan of the Great Plains, which is why I love Montana.
I think Oregon is more of an OR-1. He was one of Idaho's earliest adversaries, if I remember correctly.   I'll let myself out.   Idaho is fine. It's like a weird mixture of Montana, Oregon, and Washington. The only state it is not is Arizona.    Also, potatoes, potatoes. That is all.
> I think Oregon is more of an OR-1. He was one of Idaho's earliest adversaries, if I remember correctly.          That may have been it. I remember someone talking in a video game once or twice about Oregon, then I never noticed it again.
paraphrase:
Idaho boasts a plethora of attractive features. It offers breathtaking vistas, excellent fishing, and world-renowned potatoes (specifically, Famous Potatoes). However, some inhabitants of Idaho are determined to harm OR-7 and his other non-human companions. Despite this, I could imagine a villainous character falling in love with the state's vast Great Plains, which are reminiscent of Montana.
In contrast, Oregon is more of an OR-1, having been one of Idaho's earliest adversaries. While I can't recall the specific context, I vaguely remember someone mentioning Oregon in a video game.
> Idaho is like a unique blend of Montana, Oregon, and Washington, with a touch of its own distinct flavor. The only state it doesn't resemble is Arizona. And of course, there's always the ever-present potatoes!

input:
Valencia put a great fight but ultimately fell in the third place game of the Oaks Christian tournament.
Lonnie Jackson scored 24 points but it wasnt enough in a 66-58 overtime setback against Sacramento.
The Vikings (8
continuation:
-6) were led by Kylee Whites 14 points.
Valencias final season is in limbo. This season was its final one in the Ventura Unified School District. The Vikings are still in state championship contention.
CIF-SS action opens in Torrance, where Hartnell takes on Buena, which is looking to win its fifth championship in six seasons. Hartnell beat Buena in the state championship game, 55-38, in 2016. Buena is coached by former Hartnell star Paul Harris.
Carpinteria plays in the tournament in Camarillo, where it will take on L.A. Pierce. The Falcons beat Palisades, 61-52, in the tournament opener, while L.A. Pierce beat Ventura, 76-70, in its first game. The Vikings are coached by former Cal Poly star Derek Culver.
paraphrase:
Valencia fought hard in the Oaks Christian tournament but ultimately fell in the third-place game, losing in overtime 66-58.
While Lonnie Jackson scored 24 points, it wasn't enough as Sacramento emerged victorious. The Vikings (8-6) were led by Kylee Whites' 14 points.
As Valencia's final season in the Ventura Unified School District comes to a close, they are still in contention for the state championship. The team will face off against Hartnell in the CIF-SS action, looking to avenge their 2016 state championship loss to the Hawks.
Meanwhile, Carpinteria will face off against L.A. Pierce in the Camarillo tournament, following their 61-52 victory over Palisades in the opening game. The Vikings are coached by former Cal Poly star Derek Culver.

input:
The United Nations has restarted its process for setting rules on "responsible state behaviour in cyberspace" with two separate forums, and Australia intends to continue being a key player.
On Friday, Australia's Ambassador for Cyber Affairs Dr Tobias Feakin
continuation:
confirmed Australia's intentions to join the UN Advisory Group, which is assessing its own strategy.
"Australia is aware of the importance of multilateral engagement in this area, in which we are supportive of the UN process, which was set up under the UN Security Council Resolution, which is the only one which provides us with a mechanism in which to look at these issues in a multilateral manner," he said.
"And, of course, given what occurred in terms of Russian behaviour in relation to this, certainly, it is something which is of utmost importance. We want to play a significant role in addressing this."
Mr Feakin said the advisory group was "engaged in assessing options" for the UN's next General Assembly report in September, which will set out its own "high level principles".
"I think, in general, it is quite encouraging, if indeed it is going to happen, given some of the other initiatives, I think, in this area, to look at it more holistically, with an engagement of cyber security in mind."
"It is really quite encouraging when you look at some of these initiatives around, I think, Russia, where it seems like everybody is pushing Russia, or talking about Russia,
paraphrase:
The United Nations has revived its initiative to establish guidelines for "responsible state behavior in cyberspace" by organizing two separate forums, and Australia intends to continue playing a crucial role in this process. Australia's Ambassador for Cyber Affairs, Dr. Tobias Feakin, confirmed the country's commitment to joining the UN Advisory Group, which is currently assessing its strategy.
"Australia recognizes the significance of multilateral engagement in this realm, and we fully support the UN process established under UN Security Council Resolution," Feakin stated. "Given the recent events involving Russia's behavior in cyberspace, it is more important than ever that we work together to address these issues."
Feakin added that the advisory group is currently examining options for the UN's upcoming September report, which will outline high-level principles for responsible state behavior in cyberspace. He noted that this initiative is encouraging, particularly in light of other recent developments in the field.
"It's heartening to see various stakeholders pushing for responsible cybersecurity practices, particularly when it comes to Russia's behavior in this realm," Feakin said.

input:
During a day of events designed to raise the profile of his agenda for education, President Clinton last week urged parents and teachers to embrace a "whole ethic'' of lifelong learning to insure the nation's continued economic productivity.
"The fact of the
continuation:
matter is, with children in this country it takes twice as long to get them into college. The cost of going into college, with many universities charging more than $1,500, exceeds what it takes to buy a car. We need to think long-term.''
At an event sponsored by The Century Foundation in Washington, Mr. Clinton said his push for what he calls "a whole ethic'' of education included his support of K-12 programs, higher education, vocational education, early education, job training and apprenticeship programs, job-training apprenticeships, community colleges, technical schools and technical education centers.
Mr. Clinton said he was committed to making colleges and universities more affordable. He said he had signed a new law, which takes effect in January, requiring colleges and universities to refund $1,400 per-student interest owed on their education loans if they offer classes at less than 70 percent of usual cost. The law was signed by his successor, George W. Bush. The law was championed by Rep. Paul D. Ryan, Wisconsin Republican, chairman of the House Education Committee.
Mr. Clinton also spoke of the need for vocational education in addressing what he said was an education gap between disadvantaged children in urban centers and
paraphrase:
During a series of events aimed at elevating his agenda for education, President Clinton last week urged parents and educators to adopt a comprehensive approach to lifelong learning in order to maintain America's economic prowess.
"The reality is, it takes twice as long for children in this country to enter college, and the cost of higher education, with many universities charging over $1,500, exceeds the price of a car. We must think long-term,'' he said at an event hosted by The Century Foundation in Washington.
President Clinton emphasized his support for a wide range of educational programs, including K-12 initiatives, higher education, vocational training, early childhood education, job training, apprenticeships, community colleges, technical schools, and technical education centers.
He also reiterated his commitment to making college more affordable, highlighting a new law he signed, which goes into effect in January, requiring colleges and universities to refund $1,400 in interest owed on student loans if they offer classes at less than 70% of their usual cost. The law was championed by Representative Paul D. Ryan, chairman of the House Education Committee.
Furthermore, President Clinton stressed the importance of vocational education in addressing the educational disparities between disadvantaged children in urban areas and their peers.

input: I was given this medicine by my doctor for several health issues I was having back in 2006, Sharapova said, specifying everything from the flu to magnesium deficiency, irregular EKG heart results, and warning signs of early diabetes
continuation:
. The Russian athlete was speaking in advance of Wimbledon.

At the time, I didnt really have a goal of what I was hoping to achieve. I was just trying to get back into the game. It was really just something I didnt even know what I was in it for.

Sharapova is in her first year back from a 15-month doping ban, which saw her miss Roland Garros, Wimbledon, and the 2016 US Open.

As with many others, the Russians love of the sport is still intact, just with her tennis career changed. The Russian, who is ranked No. 3, will not participate in next years US Open, in which she was previously seeded. The tennis world was left in shock on Sunday, when the International Tennis Federation (ITF) released its decision, which saw Sharapova drop to No. 6 in the world. The Russian athlete is currently ranked No. 7, which is still in line with her pre-doping ban.

Sharapovas decision shocked many in tennis, with her former coach, Stan Wawrinka, breaking down in tears
paraphrase:
Maria Sharapova revealed that she was prescribed medication by her doctor in 2006 to address various health issues, including the flu, magnesium deficiency, irregular heart results, and early warning signs of diabetes. Speaking ahead of Wimbledon, the Russian athlete shared that she didn't have a specific goal in mind at the time, but rather was focused on getting back into the game after a prolonged absence due to a 15-month doping ban.
Sharapova is currently ranked No. 3 and will not participate in next year's US Open, where she was previously seeded. The International Tennis Federation's (ITF) decision to drop her ranking to No. 6 left the tennis world stunned, with her former coach, Stan Wawrinka, reportedly breaking down in tears. Despite the setback, Sharapova remains ranked No. 7, which is in line with her pre-doping ban ranking.

Following the Australian government citing a lack of separation of edge and core in 5G, Huawei has demonstrated what it says is full isolation of each network component in New Zealand on a trial network with Spark.
Huawei has revealed a 5G trial network
continuation:
in New Zealand. The company says it demonstrated complete isolation of end-to-end components in its new New Zealand 5G test bed. It is the first test of its kind in the world.
The trial was conducted with Spark, using only its own equipment, without any of its partner or third-party equipment, says Huawei. The company says it is already working with Spark to build further isolated testbeds, which it says it will use to help build its own test bed in Australia.
Huawei says it is in discussions with other operators in its home country of China, where 5G deployment is far more advanced. The company is also in talks with operators in Singapore, India, Russia, Poland, Malaysia, Malaysia, Indonesia, Chile, Brazil, Singapore, UK, France, Sweden, Japan, Norway, Russia, India, UK, Brazil, Chile, Turkey, Netherlands, Peru, UAE, Poland, Belgium, Netherlands, Taiwan, Japan, Norway, Russia, India, US, India, UK, UK, Malaysia, Netherlands, Turkey, Denmark, Indonesia, Turkey, Egypt, Russia, Japan, Peru, Brazil, Singapore, Poland, India, China, US, Malaysia, Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, US
paraphrase:
Huawei has reportedly demonstrated a pioneering feat in New Zealand, where it successfully isolated each network component in a 5G trial network with Spark. This marks the first of its kind in the world, as the company showcased complete separation of end-to-end components in its cutting-edge 5G test bed.
The trial was conducted exclusively with Spark's equipment, without any involvement from third-party providers, according to Huawei. The company is now collaborating with the New Zealand-based operator to build more isolated test beds, which will serve as a foundation for its upcoming Australian test bed.
Huawei has also engaged in discussions with several other operators across its home country of China, where 5G deployment is more advanced, as well as in Singapore, India, Russia, Poland, Malaysia, Indonesia, Chile, Brazil, Sweden, Japan, Norway, Russia, India, UK, France, and the US.
In summary, Huawei has demonstrated a remarkable achievement in New Zealand by isolating each network component in a 5G trial network with Spark, paving the way for further advancements in the field of 5G technology.

input:
Nigeria remains deeply divided over a ban imposed last month on television stations showing so-called "miracles".
Programmes showing miracles have disappeared from screens in compliance with an edict from the Nigeria's National Broadcasting Commission, which took effect from
continuation:
January 1.
President Muhammadu Buhari was one of dozens of religious leaders in the north-east of Nigeria who called on people to stop watching them. The action, which came into effect in response to reports of miracle curing, came just days after Mr Buhari took office in 2015.
In August, the Nigeria Broadcasting Commission (NBC) said it was going to institute fines of 1,000 naira ($10) per broadcast for any broadcast of miracle. The government also announced that "miracle" televisions would also be blocked, and a "cease-fire" declared between the government and the broadcast industry.
After pressure from regional authorities, Mr Buhari signed into law a law on April 30, lifting the ban. He also declared his intention to stop using his government to sanction the media. But his critics say he is going too far.
In response to the "cease-fire", Mr Buhari signed a new law in January, which made broadcasting "obscene" and which critics say prohibits any programmes or programmes promoting Christianity. Mr Buhari also signed laws in 2016, giving government "broadcasters" powers to impose fines of up to 20,000 naira ($
paraphrase: The ongoing controversy over televised miracles in Nigeria has continued to divide the country's citizens. Last month, the National Broadcasting Commission (NBC) enforced a ban on programs showcasing these perceived miracles, citing public outcry and concerns over their potential to cause harm. This decision was met with resistance from religious leaders, including President Muhammadu Buhari, who urged people to discontinue viewing these broadcasts. The ban came into effect in January 2015, shortly after Buhari's inauguration, and was reinforced by the NBC's threat of fines for any broadcasts deemed inappropriate. In response to public pressure, Buhari signed a law lifting the ban in April of the same year. However, the issue persists, as Buhari has since signed laws restricting the promotion of Christianity through broadcast media, with fines of up to 20,000 naira ($50 USD) imposed on offenders. The ongoing debate over the role of religion in media has sparked heated discussions and criticisms from various quarters.

paraphrase:
A man from Illinois who purchased a handgun and over 100 rounds of ammunition in Marion, Iowa, was sentenced to more than three years in federal prison yesterday.
Montarrance Wilson, age 27, from Chicago, pleaded guilty in August 2018 to attempting to buy a gun without a permit. The sentence was handed down in United States District Court in Cedar Rapids by Chief Judge Beth Bloom.
Wilson's lawyer, Paul Strype, argued in court in September 2018 that his client should be allowed to apply for his state's concealed-carry permit in Marion. However, the court found that the state test did not match state law, and therefore Wilson was unable to apply for his state permit in Marion.

He also stated that he had given his Illinois permits to his uncle.
Assistant United States Attorney Michael Smith argued in court that if Wilson were allowed to obtain his state permit, he could potentially pose a danger to the community.

input:
Education or Indoctrination in Texas?
The news from the nation's most influential state board of education is another reminder of the difficulty of creating a curriculum that passes muster with all stakeholders. In early March, the Texas board released its social studies standards
continuation:
, with much of the discussion around these standards focused on education. The standards set new benchmarks for history, geography, civics, geography, foreign language, math, reading, reading readiness, writing, civics, English language, English language arts, social studies, civics, social studies, social studies, and history. The board said it will implement the standards in January 2022.
At the same time, state legislators introduced a bill to defund education. Senate Bill 3, or SB 3, is not a bill. The only bill in it is a "recommendation" in one form or another. SB 3 seeks to eliminate funding from various school systems, local boards, charter schools, and other state funding programs.
SB 3 is a dangerous proposal, one that is being advanced in other states. For example, Governor Greg Abbott of Texas is already trying to eliminate the Education Safety Net Grant, or ESNG, which provides state aid for local education. The bill is similar in many respects, including eliminating funding, to what is currently in place in the United States under the Elementary and Secondary School Act (ESSA). But in essence, SB 3 is an attempt to "defund" education in Texas. If SB 3 were signed
paraphrase: In Texas, the debate surrounding education and indoctrination continues to rage on. The state board of education has recently released new social studies standards, which have been met with both praise and criticism. The standards set benchmarks for various subjects, including history, geography, civics, and English language arts. However, at the same time, state legislators have introduced a bill aimed at defunding education, which has sparked concerns about the future of education in Texas. Senate Bill 3, or SB 3, is not a bill in the classical sense, but rather a recommendation to eliminate funding from various school systems and state funding programs. This proposal has been likened to similar efforts in other states, including the attempt by Governor Greg Abbott to eliminate the Education Safety Net Grant, which provides state aid for local education. The passage of SB 3 would effectively "defund" education in Texas, raising concerns about the impact on students and schools.

input:
Should it be business as usual and a comfortable position of passivity, or should it answer, with action, the Palestinian call for solidarity and support?
At their base, these are the questions fuelling recent debates about the department of international relations'
continuation:
handling of the Palestinian boycott, divestment, sanctions and sanctions (BDS) campaigns. If the UN is unable to provide the diplomatic, legal and other backing required to implement resolutions like BDS, should it instead stand with those in opposition, as is the case with the US and Israel?
Or, if it is willing to back Israel, what should it say and what should it do, and which of these options will succeed in bringing about change in Israel and Palestine, and in human rights worldwide? The UN, of course, is not immune from critique. As these debates demonstrate, its policies, its approach, its priorities are often criticised, often without understanding its unique constraints, unique issues, or unique challenges.
In response to these debates, we at the UN human rights office are constantly looking for ways in which we can help, to advance justice, achieve freedom, promote respect for human rights, to support peace, help advance reconciliation, help protect human rights, promote education, fight discrimination, fight xenophobia, promote respect for human dignity, and so on. We are always looking for ways in which we can advance the universal human rights framework. We are constantly looking for ways in which, even in these difficult times, it is possible
paraphrase:
It is a matter of critical importance to choose whether to remain in a comfortable state of inaction or to actively support the Palestinian call for solidarity and assistance. The recent debates surrounding the department of international relations' handling of the Palestinian boycott, divestment, and sanctions (BDS) movements have raised fundamental questions about the UN's role in promoting justice, protecting human rights, and advancing the universal human rights framework.
As these debates have demonstrated, the UN is not immune to criticism, and its policies, approach, and priorities are frequently challenged without a full understanding of the unique constraints, challenges, and issues it faces. In response to these debates, we in the UN human rights office are continually seeking innovative ways to promote justice, advance freedom, and protect human rights, while also supporting peace and reconciliation.
Ultimately, the decision as to how the UN should respond to the Palestinian call for solidarity and support is a complex one, requiring careful consideration of a range of factors and priorities. However, by staying committed to our mission of advancing the universal human rights framework and supporting those in need, we can work towards a brighter future for all.

input:
A certain politician recently lost their very high-profile, very powerful job. While this was not a surprise to other people, they say it was a surprise to them.
They also say that what happened was unfair and uncalled for.
Despite
continuation: the usual partisan accusations, the politicians argument is based in truth. I dont believe in speaking ill of ones former boss, especially if it was only because hes a Republican. But this case was more than just one person. A former governor, a current senator, the president of one of the states largest newspapers, and one of the states most popular radio talk show hosts, were just some of the people who helped put this politician in office. But it is also true, in my opinion, that any politician who wants to stay in office, runs for office, or even runs for president needs to understand that their opponents, or anyone else who cares about something, will always try to get in his or her way. Im not talking about using any sort of intimidation or threats. Im talking about people simply acting with common sense, understanding where he or she is coming from, or simply not getting involved in any way with someones politics. It is especially important for people in politics, or even just in everyday life, to be aware of what is around them. Not just people in politics, but anyone with a brain and
paraphrase:
A high-profile politician recently faced an unexpected setback in their career. While this event may have come as a surprise to some, others saw it as a well-deserved consequence.
The politician in question argues that what happened was unfair and unjustified, despite any partisan accusations that may arise. They highlight the significant support they received from influential individuals, including a former governor, a current senator, the editor of one of the state's largest newspapers, and a popular radio talk show host.
However, they also emphasize the importance of understanding and respecting one's political opponents. Rather than resorting to intimidation or threats, they suggest that people should use common sense, empathy, and a willingness to listen to different perspectives in order to navigate political challenges effectively. In their view, this is especially crucial for politicians, but also for anyone seeking to make a positive impact in their community or in life in general.

The game, played in early August, was the only one on a Friday that month. Despite the late kickoff time of 4:45 pm, the team's energy levels remained high, according to Brownholtz.
In the second game of the season, the Notre Dame Irish defense put on an impressive display, limiting their opponents, the Wabash, to their fewest rushing yards in nearly four seasons. The Irish scored 20 points in the second half, while only allowing six in the first half, demonstrating a perfect balance of strength and conditioning.
The Irish pass rush was particularly effective, limiting Wabash's running game to just 24 carries for 97 yards, while only allowing one touchdown. The team also recorded three sacks, showcasing their stout defense. In contrast, Wabash's only rushing touchdown was set up by an Irish mistake, highlighting the Irish team's ability to capitalize on their opponents' errors.

input:
John Carney found out the hard way that the internet is just like the Hunger Games.
The Breitbart finance and economics editor was incredibly disturbed by the cover of Vogues September issue, which features actress Jennifer Lawrence posing on a boat in front
continuation:
of a breathtaking view of the Atlantic Ocean. But more disturbing was what was on the cover. The cover features a rather disturbing message: The U.S. government is going to end poverty. The caption says, In a few short decades, nearly half of the worlds children will be living in countries with poverty rates lower than those of developed nations.
Ill try to put this in context. A few days ago, a Pew Research Center survey found that almost one in five of adults in developed countries is struggling with poverty. That is more people than any other major economy  its larger even than Canadas 1 in 11, or Japans 1 in 30. Nearly 3.6 billion people are living under extreme poverty, or one in 85. (A bit of context, remember, is needed here: About 6.6 billion people live in countries with extreme poverty, which is nearly one in 90. The United States is not in this category  its in the low-income category, one in 160. That is, there are more people in poverty in the United States, say, than in Japan or even in India, although it
paraphrase:
John Carney's recent realization that the internet is not unlike the Hunger Games took an unsettling turn when he came across the Vogue September issue featuring Jennifer Lawrence. The cover image was striking, but what caught his attention was the bold message: The U.S. government aims to eradicate poverty. The caption underscored the statement, highlighting that in just a few decades, nearly half of the world's children will be living in countries with poverty rates lower than those of developed nations.
Carney's thoughts were further provoked by a recent Pew Research Center survey, which revealed that approximately one in five adults in developed countries are struggling with poverty, surpassing Canada's 1 in 11 and Japan's 1 in 30. Staggeringly, nearly 3.6 billion people live in extreme poverty, equivalent to one in 85 people. (It's important to note that approximately 6.6 billion people reside in countries with extreme poverty, which is comparable to one in 90.) While the United States is not classified as experiencing extreme poverty, with one in 160 people living in poverty, the sheer number of individuals in poverty within the country is notable, outpacing Japan and India.

input: World Sake Day or "Nihonshu no Hi" is a significant day on the Japanese calendar with celebrations held annually on 1 October. This date is considered "New Year's Day" for sake because it marks the first day of the sake
continuation:
harvest season. On 1 October, local wineries, with which one is connected, produce "honshu" which are typically sold in liquor shops around the year, making this date a day of drinking alcohol with other members of one's family. At this time, sake from other local wineries is often also available. To promote tourism in rural areas of Japan, many wineries, often of Japanese origin, also hold festivals around this date. Many of these festivals, called "honshu" or "honto" in Japanese, are traditionally "family" events involving only Japanese. Outside of rural areas, more people often participate in drinking Japanese sake, but this is often at home with people in groups or even in clubs, which may also have other "family" activities, such as "honto" itself. It is also common for people of other nationalities to participate in sake drinking.

References
paraphrase: October 1st is a momentous day in Japan, marking the beginning of the sake harvest season. It's a time when families and friends come together to indulge in the national drink, with many local wineries offering their finest brews. These events, known as "honshu" or "honto" in Japanese, often take place in rural areas and are an excellent opportunity to experience traditional Japanese culture. While some may prefer to drink sake at home with friends or in clubs, the rural festivals offer a unique atmosphere, showcasing the beauty of Japanese heritage. As a result, the popularity of these events has grown, attracting not only locals but also tourists from around the world. Whether you're a seasoned sake connoisseur or just discovering the joys of this ancient beverage, October 1st is the perfect time to indulge in Japan's national treasure.

input: James Jeans illustrations of fairylike deities garnered him a cult following, with comic book fanboys at one end of the spectrum and high-end designer Miuccia Prada at the other. Four years ago, Prada tapped Jean,

I spoke with Jean about his involvement in Pradas new book.

How did it feel working with Prada, and The Grand Temptation in general?
I was just waiting around in her office, waiting for her to call me back, and she called me. Im just a little kid with big dreams. I love working with Prada, shes a really fun-loving kind of person. The book was really easy to get her approval for. The second one was just getting her approval for The Grand Temptation: Volume 1. Everything is really easy. She
paraphrase: James Jean's collaborations with Miuccia Prada have gained him widespread recognition, with fans ranging from comic book enthusiasts to high-end designers. Four years ago, Prada tapped Jean, whose debut book "A Little God" received the 2008 Golden Art Foundation's First Book Award, to illustrate her book "The Grand Temptation." Since then, Prada has commissioned Jean to create additional illustrations for her latest book, "The Grand Temptation Volume 1: A Little God," as well as a companion book, "The Grand Temptation: The Grand Temptation: Volume 1." Jean shared his experience working with Prada, describing her as a "fun-loving" and "easy to work with" person. Overall, Jean has found the collaboration to be a positive and straightforward process.

input:
A 22-year-old man was killed in a shooting at Opry Mills, which caused chaos for shoppers inside.
First responders initially answered a call of an active shooter in the mall, which prompted a heavy police presence, but they learned the
continuation:
incident involved a fight between two young men, police said.
Officials did not say whether it was one of them or a third person, or what led up to the fight.
The second male was arrested later in the day. He is charged with attempted first-degree murder, first-degree murder, felony obstruction of justice, and felony assault.
The shooting was reported around 7:10 p.m. on Friday in the same area where authorities found the injured man with "multiple gunshot wounds." He was taken to a hospital, where he was later pronounced dead.
Officials did not disclose his identity. The shooting is under investigation.
It is currently unclear whether police arrested or detained any other suspects in this incident. Police did say they recovered a weapon, but did not provide details of it.
A witness told WKRN in Nashville, Tennessee, that it seemed like police were keeping people separated from one another. "I could tell there were police everywhere. I didn't really want to get in it, 'cause I was really freaked out, 'cause I heard it was like, multiple gunshots. So, I just left."
paraphrase:
A young man of 22 was tragically killed in a shooting at Opry Mills, causing panic among shoppers. Emergency responders initially received a call about an active shooter in the mall, leading to a heavy police presence. However, it was later discovered that the incident involved a fight between two individuals, according to police. The second party involved in the fight was arrested later that day, facing charges of attempted first-degree murder, first-degree murder, obstruction of justice, and assault.
The shooting occurred around 7:10 pm on a Friday, in the same area where the injured man was found with multiple gunshot wounds. He was rushed to the hospital, where he sadly succumbed to his injuries. Authorities have yet to release the identity of the victim. The incident is currently under investigation, with police recovering a weapon but providing no further details.
A witness to the incident spoke with WKRN in Nashville, Tennessee, describing the scene as chaotic, with police keeping people separated from one another. The witness expressed their fear, noting that they heard multiple gunshots and decided to leave the area.

input:
The seven-day plan for getting your home and yard ready for summer.
On the HouseMitch KuffaGuest columnist FHA and private home housing inspector and licensed builder Mitchell Kuffa, of St. Clair, Wednesday April 14,
continuation: 2021, will share what homeowners should look into before getting their houses ready to be toured by prospective buyers.
paraphrase:
A seven-day plan for preparing your home and outdoor space for the summer season.
Day 1: Clean and declutter your home, focusing on areas that will be visible to potential buyers.
Day 2: Conduct a thorough inspection of your roof, gutters, and downspouts to ensure they are in good condition.
Day 3: Perform any necessary repairs or updates to your home's exterior, including painting, sealing cracks, and repairing damaged siding.
Day 4: Tend to your yard and outdoor spaces, including mowing the lawn, pruning trees and shrubs, and adding any necessary landscaping features.
Day 5: Clean and organize your garage and any other outbuildings, and consider any necessary repairs or upgrades.
Day 6: Focus on the interior of your home, including cleaning and organizing your closets, cupboards, and other storage areas.
Day 7: Conduct a final walk-through of your home to ensure everything is in order before showings begin.

By following this seven-day plan, you can ensure that your home is ready for potential buyers and showcases its best features. Remember to focus on areas that will be visible to buyers and to conduct any necessary repairs or updates to make your home more attractive and appealing.

Former Indian skipper and national women's team coach Divya Singh is impressed with the talent exhibited by country's top 18 women prospects currently receiving training at the basketball development program.
NAGPUR: Former Indian skipper and national women's team coach
continuation:
Divya Singh is impressed with the talent exhibited by country's top 18 women prospects currently receiving training at the basketball development program.
Divya, the former women's basketball captain of India, is coaching the women team at the India Basketball League (IBL), which began in Mumbai on Monday. The event is played in collaboration with Airtel, with eight Airtel-owned teams.
"I am very happy with the current talent, their drive and ambition. I think India is going in the right direction. The women are improving at a rapid pace. I am confident this will help India in the Olympics, which is set to take place next year. I am confident we will get one or two more players selected in the national camp (for Olympics), Divya, 36, said.
While there is no clarity yet whether the womens team will get selected for the Tokyo Olympics, Divya said she is hopeful. "I am very hopeful. I think this will help India qualify. I am also confident this will help them qualify.
On whether she is coaching the national side or just focusing on these girls, she said: "I am also coaching the national side. I am coaching them
paraphrase:
Former Indian basketball captain and national women's team coach, Divya Singh, is impressed with the exceptional talent displayed by the country's top 18 women prospects currently receiving training at the basketball development program.
In a recent development, Divya is coaching the women's team at the India Basketball League (IBL) in Mumbai, which began on Monday. The event is being conducted in collaboration with Airtel, featuring eight Airtel-owned teams.
Expressing her satisfaction with the current crop of players, Divya, 36, believes that India is on the right path towards success in international competitions. She is confident that the women's team will continue to improve at a rapid pace, and potentially earn selection for the Olympics next year.
While there is still no confirmation regarding the women's team's participation in the Tokyo Olympics, Divya remains optimistic about India's chances. She expresses her hope that the team will qualify and make the country proud.
In response to a question regarding her coaching role, Divya clarifies that she is not only focusing on the 18 prospects but is also coaching the national side.

The 46-year-old father-of-two was found dead at Elsternwick Park in Brighton on Saturday
continuation:
afternoon. His death was initially deemed suspicious, but he was confirmed dead this afternoon.
Hester was said to have hanged himself with a curtain cord and was found unconscious just before 3pm, with paramedics arriving within minutes.
Paul, pictured here with ex-wife Amanda, was found dead in Brighton, Melbourne, this afternoon. The 46-year-old was found dead this afternoon. (Crowded House/ Instagram)
Hester was in his car when he was found dead, police said. The circumstances of his death were still being determined, and it is still not known whether he took his own life or was killed.
A funeral will be held later this week, with the former singer from Melbourne band Crowded House expected to be included.
Hester, who played drums with his brother Grant in the band from 1995 to 2003, worked as a vocalist in other acts, including Black Dog. He later formed his own band, Paul Hester And The Rockers, in 2007. The band released its debut album in 2008.
Hester is believed to have suffered from mental illness and was believed to be taking anti-depressants. He was also said to have been undergoing therapy, but was described as
paraphrase:
The entertainment industry in Australia was left reeling today as the news of former Crowded House drummer Paul Hester's tragic death spread. The 46-year-old musician was found dead in a Melbourne park on Saturday afternoon, with police confirming his death as suicide.
Hester, a beloved figure in the Australian music scene, was found unconscious in Elsternwick Park in Brighton just before 3pm. Paramedics arrived quickly and pronounced him dead at the scene.
The circumstances of Hester's death are still unclear, with police investigating whether he took his own life or was killed. His family has requested privacy as they come to terms with their devastating loss.
Hester's music career spanned several decades, including his time as drummer for Crowded House from 1995 to 2003. He also worked as a vocalist in other bands, such as Black Dog, and formed his own group, Paul Hester And The Rockers, in 2007. Their debut album was released in 2008.
Hester was reportedly struggling with mental illness and had been undergoing therapy. It is believed that he was taking anti-depressants at the time of his death.
The music industry is mourning the loss of this talented artist and a memorial service is planned for later this week. Hester's legacy will live on through his music and the impact he had on countless lives.

Candidate Master Bob Mugana inspired KCB Bank Chess Club to four wins in Mombasa helping his club go top of the 2019 Kenya Premier Chess League.
The bankers won 5-0 against Stima Chess Club, Strathmore University,
continuation:
KCB Foundation Academy, Royal High School, Makadara and Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture, where Mugana drew his match with Emmanuel Kimutai.
Mugana, in his closing remarks, said he was happy with the victory as it would propel KCB from third spot in the league table.
"I am also happy with this win because it will propel us from third place in the league table, we now need to beat Sharks in next weeks match if KCB want to stay in the league table, Mugana said.
Stima, with just two points from seven matches, is battling for second place with JKUAA.
In the womens league table, Makadara edged off KCB Foundation Academy in a match played in Busia with the bankers winning 6-1. The bankers also beat Royal High School 6-1.
Stima was only able to record a draw with KCB Foundation in the womens league match played in Kibra. The bankers beat JKUAA 6-1 in their final match. KCB Foundation beat Royal High School, Makadara 6-1 in the second match played.
paraphrase:
Candidate Master Bob Mugana's inspiration propels KCB Bank Chess Club to dominance in Mombasa, leading them to four consecutive victories and the top spot in the 2019 Kenya Premier Chess League.
The bankers cruised to a 5-0 win against Stima Chess Club, Strathmore University, KCB Foundation Academy, Royal High School, and Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture, with Mugana drawing his match against Emmanuel Kimutai.
In his closing remarks, Mugana expressed satisfaction with the victory, stating that it would help KCB move up to third place in the league standings. "We are on track to secure a top-three finish, and next week's match against Sharks will be crucial in determining our fate," he said.
Meanwhile, Stima Chess Club is fighting for second place with JKUAA, while Makadara and KCB Foundation Academy dominated the women's league with 6-1 victories over Royal High School and JKUAA, respectively.
In summary, KCB Bank Chess Club's impressive run of form has catapulted them to the top of the Kenya Premier Chess League, with Candidate Master Bob Mugana's leadership and inspiration playing a crucial role in their success.

Marriott hotel in Sao Paulo, Brazil. Photo: Marriott.com.
Forget about a struggling economy and other issues: Marriott International still plans to increase its number of locations in Brazil nearly threefold by 2018. A few years ago, Brazil
continuation:
's hotel sector was in a downward spiral, as competitors closed or began laying off staff. But in just a few short years, the local hospitality industry is rebounding, thanks in part to Marriott, which opened its first hotel in Sao Paulo in 2007, and is now looking to build more. (See chart, "Marriott in Brazil: 'Tide Is Turning,'" from September, 2013.)
"Brazil is growing fast, says Adriano Gonalves, president of Brazils Hotelier Federation (Federao Portuguesa de Hotelieria, or FHP). The governments investment in tourism infrastructure is also giving more people options. Brazil has been experiencing record-high tourism, which is expected to exceed the record of 24.1 million registered visitors in 2013. This year, tourism is expected to exceed 24.5 million.
In Brazil, it was difficult before because of the economy, Gonalves says. With the improvement in tourism, more people are coming.
In the first seven months of this year, Brazil registered 7.57 million foreign visitors. That represents a 34% increase from the same period in 2012. Of
paraphrase: Marriott plans to expand in Brazil despite economic struggles. In 2018, the company aims to triple its number of locations in the country. After a difficult period for the local hospitality industry, Marriott entered the market in 2007 and is now poised for growth. According to Adriano Gonalves, President of the Brazilian Hoteliers Federation (Federao Portuguesa de Hotelieria, or FHP), the government's investment in tourism infrastructure is driving the industry's resurgence. Tourism in Brazil is experiencing record-high numbers, with an expected 24.5 million visitors in 2018, a 34% increase from the same period in 2012.

input: You remember the tragic story about the murder of Chauncey Bailey, the editor of a weekly newspaper in Oakland, Calif., killed on Aug. 2 as he was walking to work. Police quickly made arrests following the slaying, which they think was
continuation:
the handiwork of a serial killer named Charles Dexter Wade.

In the case of Bailey, police said Wade killed his victims  in mostly similar ways  in what appeared to be random attacks with no apparent motive. The murders continued for six days  from Aug. 3 to Aug. 6. Wades motive is still a mystery. Authorities said theyve collected only small amounts of evidence from his victims, which led them to conclude he wasnt hunting for someone. Hes also suspected of raping at least one woman, and of breaking into his victims homes and stealing jewelry and cash. Police believe Wade only killed his victims in order to cover them up.

Wades first murder was in 1989, but police didnt learn his identity for nearly 20 years. It was in 2007, when police in Texas identified Wade as a suspect in the slaying of a young girl, later identified only as Amy, who was killed in 2000. Police arrested Wade, who confessed, and he confessed that he killed Amy, too. He also confessed to raping her. He was charged with murder and kidnapping, and pleaded guilty. After his conviction, Wade was sent back to Texas
paraphrase: The tragic story of Chauncey Bailey's murder in Oakland, California, is still fresh in many minds. Bailey, the editor of a local newspaper, was killed on August 2nd while walking to work, and police quickly apprehended the suspect, Charles Dexter Wade. Wade is believed to have committed a series of murders in the area, targeting his victims at random with no apparent motive. The killings continued for six days, from August 3rd to August 6th, and Wade's motive remains a mystery. Authorities have collected limited evidence from his victims, leading them to suspect that Wade was not hunting for a specific target. He is also accused of sexually assaulting at least one woman and breaking into homes to steal jewelry and cash. Police believe that Wade only killed his victims to cover his tracks. Wade's criminal history dates back to 1989, but it wasn't until 2007 that he was identified as a suspect in the murder of a young girl in Texas. Wade confessed to the crime and was charged with murder and kidnapping. He pleaded guilty and was sent back to Texas.

input:
Friends and supporters of a Tamil family, who are facing deportation, have marched through the rain to Peter Dutton's Brisbane office.
Singing The Seekers hit I am, you are, we are Australian, the protesters first rallied at a crowd
continuation:
-control checkpoint near the Qudos Bank Building.
While it was unclear why they were in the area, immigration minister Peter Dutton later said the protesters were there because of a "troubling story".
Mr Dutton said he would "have people come forward", and he would "take action".
"I have people in custody, in detention, people from countries of origin, people from Muslim countries who have been here in this country for generations and are facing this appalling, appalling decision to go to another place, I will deal with it immediately, I will deal with it properly," Mr Dutton said.
"I will deal with this with respect, with humanity, I will deal with it with respect, with humanity. The only people that I will deport from here in this country is people that pose a risk, people that have been involved in criminal activities, or are involved in terrorism."
It was unclear what crime the Tamil family of seven, from Queensland, are accused of.
An estimated 200 people rallied against the Tamil family in Brisbane. ( ABC Radio Brisbane: Sarah Keneally )
On Friday, it was revealed a 20-year-old Tamil man, Abdul Rahim, had been given a one
paraphrase: A group of supporters and friends of a Tamil family, facing potential deportation, took to the streets in Brisbane to protest. The protesters, singing The Seekers' hit "I Am, You Are, We Are Australian," initially gathered near the Qudos Bank Building before marching to Peter Dutton's office. Dutton, the immigration minister, later stated that the group was there due to a "troubling story." He assured that he would take action and address the situation with respect, humanity, and promptness. Dutton clarified that he would deport only those who pose a risk, are involved in criminal activities, or are connected to terrorism. The exact offense committed by the Tamil family of seven, from Queensland, remains unclear. An estimated 200 individuals demonstrated against the family's potential deportation. (ABC Radio Brisbane: Sarah Keneally)

input:
An organization representing Cardinal Mooney High School minority graduates is calling a classroom lesson purportedly aimed at recreating the experience of slavery, deeply troubling.
The Cardinal Mooney High School Minority Alumni Council has issued a statement saying that a Black History lesson subject
continuation:
ively called "Living Like Slaves" was "insensitive and disrespectful."
"This history-theory based curriculum was given without any consultation with the staff or students and without any time or opportunity to review it," the organization said. "These lessons were, in essence, racist in nature."
In addition, the organization said it "was only contacted with these materials a few days ago."
"Although it is easy to say that any instruction that is racist is racist, these lessons were put in place without any consultation with anyone," the organization said. "As a result, it is highly inappropriate to say that any instruction or education should be given without first making sure it is in accordance with school policies."
A second Black history course is also under scrutiny.
At least six staff members contacted by The Washington Post, either by phone or email, said they had seen or heard the same material as in the first course. All spoke on condition of anonymity due to concerns of retribution. All spoke of discomfort with its content.
"I just don't think it's right to put a history course like this on any kid's schedule without the staff or with any kind of consultation with the staff," said one member of the staff.
paraphrase: The Cardinal Mooney High School Minority Alumni Council has expressed outrage over a classroom lesson reportedly aimed at reenacting slavery, which they deem "insensitive and disrespectful." The organization claims that the lesson, titled "Living Like Slaves," was presented without proper consultation with staff or students, and was not in line with school policies. According to the organization, at least six staff members have expressed concerns about the material, which they find uncomfortable. The issue has also sparked controversy over a second Black history course under scrutiny.

input: It's 75 years since Trotsky, already expelled from the Soviet Communist Party and exiled, went to start a new life in Mexico. But he was hunted down in Mexico City by Stalinist assassins, as his grandson, who was living with him when he
continuation: was arrested, remembers.
paraphrase: For 75 years, Trotsky, once expelled from the Soviet Communist Party and exiled, sought a fresh start in Mexico. However, he was relentlessly pursued by Stalinist assassins in Mexico City, as his grandson, who shared a home with him during his arrest, vividly recalls.

input:
The attorney general said he wants to improve protections of medical service and see a more representative board manage sale proceeds.
ASHEVILLE  State Attorney General Josh Stein said Tuesday he wants to see changes in the proposed sale of Mission Health to HCA Healthcare
continuation:
, and hell meet with representatives of the medical system.
At the same time, he also said hes looking at ways to help manage Medicare reimbursements, which he said could benefit Mission Health.
Its important that the next partner meets Mission Healths needs, he said in his office in downtown Asheville.
A press release from Mission Health says it was asked Tuesday if it wants to comment on Steins agenda. The company did not immediately respond.
The state attorney general is urging the states Medical Licensure Review Board to maintain medical standards. He said he also will want to maintain medical practices of Mission Healths Mission Family, which provides physical, occupational, speech, behavioral, medical, occupational, social, faith-based and school-based services. Mission Family also operates the states first-ever in-home dialysis program. It is based in Buncombe County.
I want them to be able to maintain whats here, Stein said, and maintain it at the same time.
Stein also said he wants to see more women of color, more
paraphrase:
Attorney General Josh Stein expressed his desire to improve the protection of medical services and witness a more diverse management team overseeing the sale proceeds. He is scheduled to meet with representatives of Mission Health to discuss potential changes to the proposed acquisition by HCA Healthcare. Stein is also exploring ways to optimize Medicare reimbursements, which he believes could benefit Mission Health.
In a statement from his office in Asheville, Stein emphasized the importance of selecting a partner that aligns with Mission Health's needs. He stressed the need for the next partner to maintain medical standards and uphold the medical practices of Mission Health's Mission Family, which provides a wide range of services, including physical, occupational, speech, behavioral, medical, occupational, social, faith-based, and school-based services. Additionally, Mission Family operates the state's first in-home dialysis program, based in Buncombe County.
Stein emphasized the need for diversity in the management team, expressing a desire to see more women of color in leadership positions. He believes that this would contribute to a more representative and inclusive management structure.
Overall, Stein's agenda aims to ensure that Mission Health's medical services are protected and maintained, while also promoting diversity and inclusivity in the management team.

input:
How secure is your data on WhatsApp? Well, we answer all the top questions related to your privacy on the worlds most popular messaging application.
Last year, Facebook-owned WhatsApp rolled out end-to-end encryption for more than
continuation:
200 million users. Now, it is available for millions of more WhatsApp users. This is undoubtedly one of the biggest privacy concerns for many. But WhatsApp is also offering end-to-end encryption, which gives the user complete control. Here is what you need to know about end-to-end encryption in WhatsApp. Here are the basic rules of WhatsApp end-to-end encryption. Read more: WhatsApp: Why end-to-end encryption may be dangerous for privacy  Explained.
What is end-to-end encryption?
End-to-end encryption is a secure way of sending and receiving messages. The senders phones microphone, camera, and even location are never used while sending or receiving messages. WhatsApp end-to-end encryption is available for only 20 million WhatsApp users currently. For the remaining users, WhatsApp offers end-to-end encryption, which offers complete control of your privacy. WhatsApp end-to-end encryption is still in early stages of testing, and will go live officially later this year. Read more: WhatsApp: Will WhatsApp end-to-end encryption help save privacy of users?  Explained. The privacy of end-to-end encrypted messages will also remain
paraphrase:
WhatsApp's data security is a top concern, and last year, the company rolled out end-to-end encryption for over 200 million users. Now, this encryption is available to millions more. This is a significant privacy issue for many, but WhatsApp is also offering end-to-end encryption, giving users complete control. Here are the basic rules of WhatsApp's end-to-end encryption. Want to know more? Read our article on WhatsApp: Why end-to-end encryption may be dangerous for privacy.
So, what exactly is end-to-end encryption? It's a secure way of sending and receiving messages, and crucially, the sender's microphone, camera, and location are never used during transmission. Currently, end-to-end encryption is available to just 20 million WhatsApp users, but the company is also offering a less secure version for the remaining users, giving them complete control over their privacy. WhatsApp's end-to-end encryption is still in the testing phase and will go live officially later this year. input: For those who dont remember, Bulworth is a brilliant 1998 film by Warren Beatty, depicting a corrupted and suicidal liberal senator from California who is facing a primary challenge while dealing with financial ruin. Unable to sleep or eat, Bulworth
continuation:
goes around town with a rag in his mouth, acting as if he is mentally ill. The movies brilliance came from its use of surreal imagery, especially the bizarre scenes of people entering his head. It also helped popularize the term invisibility.

In this case, its hard to say whether the people entering Mr. Beattys head are his critics or his brain. Thats what happens when one is dead. But the more I think about it, Im getting more of a vibe of people entering Mr. Beattys head. Im getting more of a vibe of a little bit of Mr. Beattys soul. Because while hes dying, hes also getting much more of what he always had: his own private mind.

In his last days, Mr. Beattys mind seems to have been growing more confused, especially when hes been drinking, which was quite often. I think he was going through something like Mr. Karps book  a journey into Mr. Beattys own mind. Heres
paraphrase: In this passage, the author is reflecting on the 1998 film "Bulworth" directed by Warren Beatty, which tells the story of a corrupt and suicidal liberal senator from California. The author notes that the film's brilliance lies in its use of surreal imagery, particularly the bizarre scenes of people entering the protagonist's head. The author muses that it is difficult to determine whether these people are critics or mere manifestations of the protagonist's own thoughts. As the protagonist nears death, the author suggests that his mind is becoming increasingly confused, perhaps due to his heavy drinking habits. The author implies that the protagonist's final days are a journey into his own mind, akin to the experiences described in Mr. Karp's book.

input:
Chelsea stand one win away from the Premier League title after mounting an impressive comeback to beat Leicester City at the King Power Stadium.
Jose Mourinho's side needed to call on all their reserves of quality and resilience to overcome Leicester City's fiercely determined challenge which
continuation:
saw them score twice in six minutes early in the second half.
Fikayo Tomori was left frustrated with his defensive performance at Leicester, while Ruben Loftus-Cheek was handed his first league start in over a month, but it was midfielder Ruben Loftus-Cheek who scored his first goal in over one month to clinch victory.
And while Chelsea are only one win away from sealing the league title, Mourinho said his side's performances are yet more evidence of his side's ability to win even with key players out.
"It's fantastic, fantastic, fantastic," Mourinho said, as quoted in Chelsea's official website. "I'm so happy with everybody, but especially Ruben Loftus-Cheek.
"After this performance, he played 30 minutes, and everybody knows his performance, his desire, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment, his commitment. It was fantastic, fantastic, fantastic.
"And in my opinion, it was the performance of his career, or what we think his performance was. Because he was in the game,
paraphrase:
Chelsea are on the cusp of Premier League glory after a thrilling comeback against Leicester City at the King Power Stadium.
Despite facing a fierce challenge from the hosts, Jose Mourinho's side displayed their resolve and quality to secure a hard-fought victory.
Fikayo Tomori was left frustrated with his defensive display, while Ruben Loftus-Cheek was given his first league start in over a month. However, it was midfielder Ruben Loftus-Cheek who stole the show with a goal in over a month and clinched the win for Chelsea.
Mourinho hailed his team's performance, stating, "It's an incredible achievement, incredible, incredible, incredible. I'm so proud of every single player, but especially Ruben Loftus-Cheek. His performance was top-notch, and he showed his dedication and commitment to the team."
Loftus-Cheek's impressive display has further solidified his place in the Chelsea lineup, with Mourinho praising his commitment and desire.
"It was an outstanding performance from Ruben, and he proved why he's such an important player for us. He's shown his quality and dedication time and time again, and this performance was no exception," Mourinho added.
Chelsea are now one win away from securing the Premier League title, and Mourinho's side are proving their ability to triumph even with key players unavailable.

input:
Meet JOOR CEO Kristin Savilia who crafted herself into a retail guru who champions women in tech.
Kristin started her career as a buyer at Macys, so she understood firsthand the pain points of retailing and how JOOR
continuation:
is tackling it. Kristin also co-founded the Silicon Slopes Entrepreneurs Forum (SIEGF)  a Silicon Valley-based event specifically focusing on women in technology.
What is JOOR (pronounced JO-er)? Why is it relevant to women in tech? Why did you start it in San Francisco?
I think we are really missing out on this business niche that is really important. I love tech, but I also love fashion. I want to help women understand why fashion is important, why it matters, why it should matter, how fashion should be created. I like to think of it as more of an education. I think its a learning journey. Its a conversation around it. Its like going to school. Its something well never really understand, but what we do know is its super important. Its a conversation around the ways its used, its used in commerce, its used in other industries. I think we want people to think of it as something super important.
I want people to think of it as something super important. Kristin Savilia
paraphrase:
Kristin Savilia, the CEO of JOOR, has established herself as a prominent figure in the retail industry, particularly in the realm of women in tech. With a career starting as a buyer at Macy's, Kristin has firsthand experience in understanding the challenges of retail and how JOOR is tackling these issues.
JOOR, pronounced JO-er, is a platform that aims to provide an education on the importance of fashion in various industries, including commerce and technology. Kristin believes that there is a significant gap in the market when it comes to understanding the impact of fashion, and she seeks to bridge this gap through JOOR.
San Francisco was chosen as the location for JOOR due to its reputation as a hub for technology and innovation. By starting JOOR in this city, Kristin aims to create a community of like-minded individuals who share her passion for fashion and technology.
In her own words, Kristin describes JOOR as a "learning journey" that aims to educate people on the importance of fashion in various industries. She sees JOOR as a platform that fosters conversation and understanding around the ways in which fashion is used and its significance in commerce and other fields.
Through JOOR, Kristin hopes to create a space where people can engage in meaningful discussions and learn from one another, ultimately leading to a deeper understanding of the role that fashion plays in our lives.

input: In the coming days, much of the coverage of the Chernobyl disaster in Russia is likely to focus on the 30-year anniversary and commemorations of it. The same may be said of reporting in Ukraine and Belarus, countries directly affected by the ramifications
continuation:
of the accident. But Im here to draw attention to what is going on in more than one place  in Ukraine, Russia, and the US.

At least 30,000 people were exposed to radiation from Chernobyl, which was destroyed in 1986, according to the International Atomic Energy Agency. More than 100,000 people have died in Belarus (where one third of Chernobyls contaminated area still exists) due to fallout from the accident, which is believed to have been caused by a power plant built nearby. Many thousands of people in Ukraine also died. Many others were contaminated by drinking water contaminated with radioactive material, which has led to various cancers, especially in children. (A new report released this month by the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control says more than 1,500 new cases of leukaemia, lymphoma, and myeloma were diagnosed between 1986 and 2016. Those diagnosed in 2016 with these cancers had nearly twice the odds of getting them from drinking contaminated water, according to preliminary estimates, according to The Guardians Andrew Rennie.) The US is just beginning to notice these effects, but in just the last decade, an estimated 1,500 people in the US have been diagnosed
paraphrase:
In the upcoming days, the focus of Chernobyl disaster coverage in Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus is expected to shift towards the 30th anniversary and commemorative events. However, I aim to draw attention to the situation in multiple locations within these countries, including Ukraine, Russia, and the US.
According to the International Atomic Energy Agency, around 30,000 people were exposed to radiation from the 1986 Chernobyl disaster. The World Health Organization reports that more than 100,000 people have died in Belarus due to the accident's radioactive fallout, with one-third of the contaminated area still existing in the country. Thousands of people in Ukraine also succumbed to the effects of the disaster.
Drinking water contaminated with radioactive materials has led to various cancers, particularly among children, with the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control estimating that more than 1,500 new cases of leukaemia, lymphoma, and myeloma were diagnosed between 1986 and 2016. Preliminary estimates suggest those diagnosed in 2016 had nearly twice the odds of getting these cancers from contaminated water. Meanwhile, in the US, an estimated 1,500 people have been diagnosed with these cancers in the past decade.

input:
The Scottish Rugby Union is poised to take a step into the unknown by buying a stake in a professional rugby club in the United States.
A bid has been made for a minority share in Old Glory DC, an expansion club based in Washington DC who
continuation:
are set to start life in next years Rugby League United (RLU)  the newly-formed fourth-tier league in the United States.
An announcement is expected in the next few days. If successful, it will be the first-ever investment in a Rugby League Club in Scotland.
Although the deal is yet to be signed off, sources in Scotland confirmed the proposal will go before the Scottish Rugby Board later this week, with the decision expected around 1pm.
Old Glorys owners will look to partner with Scottish Rugby, which was looking to partner with clubs in other countries in Europe, to invest in Old Glory.
In the US, Old Glory will initially contest in the RLU with a home schedule which will begin in January. The Scottish Rugby Board said: "The Scottish Rugby Board has been made aware of a proposal to purchase a minority shareholding in Washington DC-based professional Rugby League club Old Glory.
"A proposal will be made in due course."
In January, former Scotland star Richie McCaw said: "It is going to be interesting, with these guys in the States, whether or not rugby league is going to gain a new fan base or if theyll be
paraphrase:
The Scottish Rugby Union is set to embark on an innovative venture by investing in a professional rugby club in the United States. A bid has been made for a minority stake in Old Glory DC, an expansion team based in Washington DC, who are preparing to join the newly-formed Rugby League United (RLU) league in the US.
If approved, this investment will mark the first time Scottish Rugby has invested in a rugby league club outside of Scotland. The deal is expected to be finalized in the coming days, with sources indicating that the Scottish Rugby Board will deliberate on the proposal later this week.
Old Glory's ownership group is reportedly interested in collaborating with Scottish Rugby to expand their reach in the US market. As part of the partnership, Old Glory will compete in the RLU starting in January, with a home schedule that will begin in the new year.
Scottish Rugby Board chairman, Mike Griffiths, recently commented on the proposal, stating, "We have been made aware of a proposal to purchase a minority shareholding in Washington DC-based professional Rugby League club Old Glory. A proposal will be made in due course."
Former Scotland international Richie McCaw previously expressed excitement about the potential for rugby league to gain popularity in the US, saying, "It's going to be interesting to see how these guys in the States do with rugby league. Whether they'll gain a new fan base or not, I don't know."

input:
David Catania Hopes Experience Is Enough to Lead D.C.
Catania: "This election is going to be about trust"
David Catania believes his 17 years on the D.C. Council are enough to trump his competitors in
continuation: a race for mayor. He spoke with Washingtonian Editor in Chief David Kline about why he should be elected.
