Thermal emission from erupting volcanoes on the Jupiter's moon Io. A logarithmic scale is used to classify volcanoes on the basis of thermal emission; the larger the spot, the larger the thermal emission.
A new map of
continuation:
Io, which is still under construction, reveals details of volcanic activity from the volcanic shield plume. The new map, made using new volcanic models and techniques, is the first of its kind in the Solar System, researchers said.
"In general, models of volcanic activity in Jupiter's Europa are based on thermal emission from volcanic vents, where thermal energy is transmitted to the surface of Europa, where it is absorbed by the icy surface. The new volcanic models that were used in making the new map were developed in collaboration with other researchers around the world," said Robert J. A. McFarland, professor of planetary science at UC Santa Cruz. "These new volcanic models, in particular, will help us understand whether volcanic vents like these could support the current type of volcanoes seen in Europa, even if Europa is even more icy, which we think it is."
Researchers made the new Volcano Surface Model (VSIM) using new techniques of volcano simulations, allowing them to understand volcanic activity in volcanoes in terms of thermal emission. The new volcanic models, which are much more accurate, are expected to help researchers understand why volcanoes are inactive in Europa, where conditions are far harsher, even more icy, than what is expected in Jupiter's
paraphrase:
The thermal emission from erupting volcanoes on Jupiter's moon Io is mapped using a logarithmic scale to classify volcanoes based on their thermal output. The new map, currently under construction, provides detailed information on volcanic activity and is the first of its kind in the Solar System, according to researchers.
New volcanic models and techniques were developed in collaboration with international researchers to create the map. These models will help scientists understand whether volcanic vents like those on Io could support current volcanoes in Europa, even if the moon is even more icy than previously thought.
Researchers used volcano simulations and a new Volcano Surface Model (VSIM) to analyze volcanic activity in Io. The updated models are more accurate and will help scientists understand why volcanoes are inactive in Europa, despite harsher conditions.
The study of Io's volcanoes provides insights into the geological processes that shape the surface of other icy bodies in the Solar System, such as Europa. By understanding how volcanoes function on Io, scientists can better understand how they might function on other celestial bodies, which could potentially support life.

input:
Powerful senator and family patriarch Ted Kennedy has been working back channels to promote niece Caroline as the replacement for Hillary Rodham Clinton in the Senate, family sources told The Post.
The elder Kennedy (D-Mass.), whos battling brain cancer
continuation:
, has urged his niece, 46, to replace the ex-secretary of state, according to sources close to her.
While Hillarys supporters are pushing hard for her elevation, Ted  whos also battling cancer  is urging her to pass on his office, sources said.
"I don't want to say anything to hurt his health, said one of her staffers. "I just think she should go in."
Another source said the move is in preparation for the 2008 presidential election.
"It's his way of thinking ahead, said the former staffer. "With him, it's been 'we'll never win.' But it was important for her, if she wants it, to let him know what she was thinking.
The younger Ted (D-Mass.) is more conservative than his mother, former presidential candidate Bobby Kennedy, and Hillary, said a former classmate.
"I dont think he'll endorse, said the classmate, also a Democrat. "I think it's just a way of signaling, 'I want her to run.'
While she was his closest friend, Ted was "shy with women,
paraphrase:
Senior Massachusetts Senator Ted Kennedy, fighting brain cancer, has been secretly promoting his niece Caroline as Hillary Rodham Clinton's replacement in the Senate, according to sources close to the Kennedy family. Despite strong support from Clinton's allies, Kennedy has urged his niece, 46, to take on the role, reportedly believing that she would be a strong contender in the 2008 presidential election.
While Caroline Kennedy's staff members are hesitant to comment on the matter, sources suggest that Kennedy's cancer diagnosis has made him reconsider his political legacy and want to ensure that his family's legacy continues in the right hands. The move is seen as a strategic move by Kennedy to position his niece for a potential future presidential bid.
Caroline Kennedy, who is more conservative than her mother, Robert Kennedy, and Clinton, has been building her political profile in recent years. However, her uncle's endorsement would be a significant boost to her candidacy, according to a former classmate of Kennedy's.
Despite the speculation, Caroline Kennedy has yet to publicly comment on the matter, and it remains to be seen if she will ultimately accept the challenge. Nevertheless, Ted Kennedy's efforts to promote his niece as a potential successor demonstrate his continued influence in Massachusetts politics.

input:
Hourly workers aren't the only ones who have to track hours worked.
2 What if a Salaried Employee Works More Than 40 Hours?
Ask two workers if they prefer a salary or hourly wage, you will likely get two different answers
continuation:
. That's fine. But one difference in perspective could raise more concerns than one.
In his article in Forbes, "Hourly Workforce, Hourly Pay", Greg McBride, Bankrate.com, "Top Money Guru", lists the differences between salaried and hourly employment. This list is in contrast to his own recent article, "It All Adds Up." in which he did talk about this difference. McBride states: "I'm a big fan of hourly jobs, which I think offer more flexibility. It just depends on which option is more valuable to you."
With this, I also asked myself which option I prefer. I chose hourly. Here are his reasons:
 I like that I don't know when I'll get called in, I'll get to choose what I work on, I don't get to set my own hours. I prefer it because I like freedom. I like it because it gives me more flexibility with my schedule. It's much easier to find someone new than someone to replace someone. I like it because it frees me from any type of job, it just puts me in service of clients. It is more enjoyable than I've worked in a job
paraphrase:
While hourly workers are indeed responsible for tracking their worked hours, salaried employees may also find themselves logging extra hours beyond the standard 40-hour workweek. However, this doesn't necessarily mean that they are entitled to overtime pay. In an article for Forbes, Greg McBride, a renowned personal finance expert, explores the differences between salaried and hourly employment, highlighting the advantages and disadvantages of each approach.
In his article, McBride emphasizes that each employee has their unique preferences and values, and these differences can sometimes lead to conflicting perspectives. For instance, while some workers may prefer the flexibility and unpredictability of hourly work, others may find value in the stability and job security that comes with a salary.
When asked which option he prefers, McBride himself leans towards hourly work, citing the freedom and flexibility it offers. He explains that with hourly work, he doesn't know when he'll be called in, allowing him to choose his work and determine his schedule. Moreover, he finds the lack of set hours to be a significant advantage, as it gives him more control over his time and work-life balance.
Ultimately, the choice between salaried and hourly work depends on an individual's personal preferences and priorities. While hourly work may offer more flexibility, salaried positions can provide job security and stability. As McBride notes, it's crucial to weigh the pros and cons of each option and decide which one aligns better with your values and lifestyle.

input:
KINSHASA Democratic Republic of Congo's top court on Monday definitively excluded opposition leader Jean-Pierre Bemba from December's presidential election because of a witness tampering conviction at the International Criminal Court.
KINSHASA Congolese
continuation:
court bans Jean-Pierre Bemba from presidential vote, ruling was final: sources
"I am happy with this decision, justice was served," said opposition leader Etienne Tshisekedi, in remarks carried on social media. "It is important for us. It was important to us."
While Congo was awaiting final rulings on cases of alleged electoral fraud, its presidential election drew international attention amid concerns it would be marred by widespread corruption.
In September, Congolese voters will choose new lawmakers in a parliamentary vote, where a bloc led by Tshisekedi, was expected to gain control of key ministries. The election was also expected to further strengthen the influence of Tshisekedi's opposition coalition.
In its judgment, the Conseil d'tat of the Democratic Republic of Congo (Conseil de l'tat), said its decision was final. It also said it could annul the election results if it found "serious and significant irregularities" in voter lists.
More than one hundred people have been arrested in Kinshasa in recent days in raids linked to investigations into possible electoral fraud. Tshisekedi is one of the opposition's key leaders.
paraphrase: The Democratic Republic of Congo's highest court has barred Jean-Pierre Bemba from participating in the upcoming presidential election due to his conviction for witness tampering at the International Criminal Court. This decision was met with joy from opposition leader Etienne Tshisekedi, who deemed it a victory for justice. The court's ruling was final and could lead to the election results being annulled if there are found to be "serious and significant irregularities" in voter lists. Recent raids in Kinshasa have resulted in over 100 arrests in connection to investigations into possible electoral fraud, with Tshisekedi being one of the opposition's key leaders.

Berg hatched the great-looking B

A few days later, he came home and whipped up his first menu. A couple of months later, it was ready.
I dont really get involved in the menu of any of his other restaurants, says Berg. I like working with other chefs.
In his spare time, he was working at The Great Wolf Lodge with other young, successful chefs.
Its nice when people are happy with what youve created, says Berg.
A cheeseburger is something you want when you go to one of your favourite places. Its like, Oh, I love it! I want it!  says Berg.
His approach is to create a menu based on something he really loves. His favourite menu items are the burger, chicken salad,
paraphrase: Benjamin Berg, the mastermind behind B.B. Lemon, has a passion for creating inviting venues that showcase his culinary creativity. In 2014, he transformed a former barbershop in one of the city's oldest neighborhoods into a cozy eatery that serves up signature dishes, including his iconic cheeseburgers. Berg's love for burgers knows no bounds, and he takes great pleasure in crafting menus that cater to his customers' cravings. When he's not busy running his kitchen, Berg can be found working with other talented chefs at The Great Wolf Lodge, where he enjoys the satisfaction of seeing people enjoy the dishes he's created. For Berg, it's all about delivering quality and pleasing his patrons. After all, there's nothing quite like the feeling of knowing someone is enjoying something you've made with your own two hands.

input: The dominant position that Microsoft software occupies on the desktop has long been a major source of competitive advantage to Microsoft. Not only does it ensure that users of Microsoft software are familiar with the look and feel of the Microsoft interface but it also has provided a launch
continuation:
pad from which Microsoft's competitors have been able to compete, in terms of both offering and performance, with Microsoft software. For example, Apple, in contrast to Microsoft, is able to offer competing software running on MacOS which is free from Windows software. This, in turn, gives Apple an even larger competitive advantage in the desktop computing market, where Microsoft is by far the dominant player.

In recent years, the desktop environment of choice for Windows, MacOS, GNU/Linux, etc. has been Linux, due to its low cost of ownership, ease of use, and popularity with consumers. The growth of popularity of Linux in recent years, has enabled third party applications which, in turn, enable Windows applications to offer competitive performance when compared with other desktop applications running in native Windows software. This enables Windows software, which is still often found in popular applications (e.g. Word or PowerPoint) to compete with applications running in native Linux software, such as GNOME, KDE, X11, and Xamarin. As a result, in recent years, third party software which is designed to compete with native Windows applications, has been able to deliver competitive desktop applications in terms of performance. This is often the case even when compared with
paraphrase:
Microsoft's long-held dominance on the desktop has been a significant source of competitive advantage for the company. Not only does it ensure familiarity among users of Microsoft software, but it also provides a springboard for competitors to offer and perform better than Microsoft software. For instance, Apple, unlike Microsoft, can offer competing software on MacOS that is free from Windows software, giving it an even greater edge in the desktop computing market, where Microsoft is the dominant player.
In recent years, the preferred desktop environment for Windows, MacOS, and GNU/Linux has been Linux, due to its cost-effectiveness, user-friendliness, and popularity with consumers. The growing popularity of Linux has enabled third-party applications, which in turn enable Windows applications to match the performance of native Linux applications. This enables Windows software, often found in popular applications like Word and PowerPoint, to compete with applications running in native Linux environments, such as GNOME, KDE, X11, and Xamarin. As a result, recent third-party software designed to compete with native Windows applications has been able to deliver competitive desktop applications in terms of performance, even when compared to native Linux software.

A motorcyclist from Worthing suffered fatal injuries following a collision with two cars on the A286 in Birdham, near Chichester, yesterday.
The 56-year-old motorcyclist from Worthing collided with a Jaguar travelling in
continuation:
the same direction at around 1.55pm, while he was in his car. His motorcycle hit the car's back side before sliding off the road. It left the road and came to rest in woodland.
Police are appealing for witnesses.
paraphrase:
A tragic incident occurred on the A286 in Birdham, near Chichester, yesterday, resulting in the death of a motorcyclist from Worthing. The 56-year-old victim collided with two vehicles, a Jaguar and his own car, while traveling in the same direction at around 1:55 pm. The motorcycle struck the back of the Jaguar before sliding off the road and coming to rest in a nearby woodland.
The police are urging anyone who may have witnessed the accident to come forward and provide information.

In its answer to Amazon, Google's new umbrella program will extend existing relationships with retailers and enable universal checkout across platforms and devices.
Google has been working on retail challenges for some time. The problems: (1) how to make mobile shopping from
continuation:
multiple retailers easy; (2) mobile commerce is still limited; (3) mobile commerce is expensive. Google is in many ways tackling these challenges in a single strategy. It launched Google X, a new venture devoted solely to shopping, in late 2015, with big names like Jeff Bezos (CEO of Amazon), Jamie Dimon (CEO of J.C. Penney) and Tony Robbins (CEO of YMCA) signing onto Google X projects. At this time, Google is focusing its efforts with merchants in this area. This is a strategy with significant appeal to brick-and-mortar merchants, which are still trying to find ways to increase foot traffic in light of declining revenue. The Google X website notes, "Google's retail research is one of the only big-data initiatives of its size, scale, and importance."
This is Google's third attempt to put its power in e-commerce. In 2005, Google bought DoubleClick, an Internet advertising company, for $3.1 billion. It launched Google Shopping in 2007, with major retailers like Sears, Nike, Adidas, Apple, Kmart, Walmart, Macys, and Macys. The following year, Google launched Google Shopping Express with Sears
paraphrase:
Google's new umbrella program will enhance existing partnerships with retailers and enable seamless checkout across platforms and devices.
Google has been working on retail challenges for some time, with the main issues being how to make mobile shopping from multiple retailers easy, how to expand mobile commerce beyond its current limitations, and how to reduce the cost of mobile commerce. Google is tackling these challenges in a single strategy by focusing its efforts on retailers through its new venture, Google X, which was launched in late 2015 with prominent industry figures like Jeff Bezos, Jamie Dimon, and Tony Robbins on board. Google X is placing significant emphasis on working with merchants to address these challenges, as brick-and-mortar retailers are still seeking ways to boost foot traffic in light of declining revenue. According to the Google X website, "Google's retail research is one of the largest and most significant big-data initiatives of its kind."
This marks Google's third attempt to assert its influence in the e-commerce space. In 2005, the company acquired DoubleClick, an Internet advertising firm, for $3.1 billion. In 2007, Google launched Google Shopping, partnering with major retailers like Sears, Nike, Adidas, Apple, Kmart, Walmart, Macy's, and more. The following year, Google introduced Google Shopping Express, collaborating with Sears on the initiative.

Stephen Jones put Wasps 3-0 ahead before two Freddie Burns penalties and a converted James Simpson-Daniel try gave the hosts a
continuation:
bonus-point win.
The Wasps second row was only introduced late in the first period after Simon Berghan was unable to cope with the onslaught from Gloucester's forwards.
"In general, I'm pleased with the performance from everybody, especially Freddie (Burns)," Jones said. "A bit of luck from Freddie was the difference, which we didn't need. I'm just happy with the result. I don't think I need any more analysis."
Worcester, back in Premiership action for the first time this season, will go into the international break with something to smile about, with captain Charlie Hodgson scoring his first try in 20 matches.
"I'm happy with what I've done, just happy with myself," he said. "I've tried to get myself back into the team, been injured, so it's just nice to get back in here and get my try. It's just been tough. Hopefully I'll build from it."
With centre Ben Earl already confirmed to captain England, his replacement, Freddie Burns, made his first competitive start.
He could hardly believe he had managed to get his first try in Wasps colours, with a neat back-heel from centre Joe Launch
paraphrase:
Gloucester claimed their second victory of the season by defeating Wasps for the third time in a row.
Early on, Stephen Jones gave Wasps a 3-0 lead, but Freddie Burns scored two penalties and a converted try to give the hosts a bonus-point win. Wasps' second row was only introduced late in the first half after Simon Berghan struggled to cope with Gloucester's forward pressure.
"I'm pleased with the team's performance overall, particularly Freddie's (Burns) contribution," Jones said. "A bit of luck from Freddie made the difference, which we didn't need. I'm just happy with the result."

"I'm pleased with my own performance and just happy to be back in the team," Hodgson said. "I've been injured and it's been tough, so it's nice to get back out there and score a try. I hope to build on this performance."
With center Ben Earl confirmed to captain England, his replacement, Freddie Burns, made his first competitive start and was overjoyed to score his first try in Wasps colors with a clever backheel from center Joe Launch.

input:
Having joined the ranks of perennial college football bowl participants, Northwestern University also now has joined the ranks of schools at which a coach has the highest annual compensation.
Pat Fitzgerald was credited with more than $2.2 million in compensation during the 2011 calendar
continuation:
year, according to newly-commissioned annual contracts of his head coaching staff, which were released Tuesday. The Wisconsin head coachs average annual base salary was $1.93 million, according to the contract, which also lists Fitzgeralds contract bonus  which was capped at $500,000  as well as his per diem, which he is eligible for while coaching his alma mater. He is also eligible for annual incentives.
Fitzgerald, who also made more than $1.2 million from the Wildcats television contract in addition to his coaching paycheck, is now third in the league with his per diem  just six percentage points behind Virginia Techs Justin Fuente, whose per diem was listed at $1.93 million. His annual base salary in 2011 was $1.75 million, according to the contract, while his per diem was listed at $20,664. He is eligible for annual incentives.
Fitzgeralds contract also includes a $500,000 performance-based bonus, according to the contract. His contract, which also lists bonuses based on win-loss records, is one of two in the league that was included in the
paraphrase: Northwestern University has joined an elite group of collegiate football bowl participants, and its head coach, Pat Fitzgerald, is now among the highest-paid coaches in the league. According to recently released contracts, Fitzgerald received over $2.2 million in compensation in 2011, with a base salary of $1.93 million and additional bonuses for performance and television contracts. Fitzgerald's per diem is also notable, at $1.93 million, putting him in third place in the league, just six percentage points behind Virginia Tech's Justin Fuente. Fitzgerald's contract also includes a $500,000 performance-based bonus, and he is eligible for annual incentives.

input:
Almost three weeks after a primary that wiped out two incumbents, the remaining candidates for Carroll County commissioner are struggling to show voters that they're much different from each other.
Most of the candidates mounted successful primary campaigns by saying they would not be like
continuation:
their opponents, and this is what voters hear in many of their debates. But in the last few days, they are trying something else.
Some are attacking one another, and it's getting ugly. The feuding is reminiscent of the bad feelings before this year's general election, in which voters chose Democrat Al Currey over Republican Bill Carroll, and in which Democrat Al Zidevsky was soundly beaten by Bill Hall.
On Tuesday, in a debate sponsored by Carroll's Democratic organization, Carroll and former state Rep. Matt Ritter were asked if anyone was like former state Rep. Jerry Miller, who was defeated in the GOP race Tuesday. The debate, which was broadcast live on the Carroll County Public Access Network, was billed as a chance to hear candidates debate "their own type of personality" rather than just attacking one another.
But Carroll, in his closing argument, made the case that Miller never did any of the things he said he would.
"I heard him talk about his ability to get things done, his ability to get people back in jobs," Carroll said. "I don't remember him ever getting anything done. He was never elected. He wasn't even a member of this commission. He was never
paraphrase:
In the aftermath of a contentious primary that eliminated two incumbents, the remaining candidates for Carroll County commissioner are struggling to differentiate themselves from one another. While some have successfully campaigned by painting themselves as starkly different from their opponents, recent efforts have seen candidates turn to personal attacks and mudslinging.
This trend is reminiscent of the bitter feuds that characterized the lead-up to last year's general election, which saw Democrats Al Currey and Bill Hall emerge victorious over their Republican opponents.
In a recent debate sponsored by Carroll's Democratic organization, candidates were given the opportunity to showcase their unique personalities and qualifications. However, rather than focusing on their own strengths, some candidates chose to attack their opponents, leading to an ugly and unproductive exchange.
Despite this, Carroll County commissioner candidate Bill Carroll remained focused on his opponent's lack of accomplishments and credentials, highlighting the contrast between his own campaign promises and the former state representative's inability to deliver.
In conclusion, the candidates for Carroll County commissioner must move beyond personal attacks and emphasize their distinct qualifications and visions for the county's future. By focusing on their own strengths and ideas, they can create a more productive and inspiring campaign.

input: EXCLUSIVE: Imagine Impact is launching its second mentoring program. The program launched last year, to find new writer voices and give them a seat at the table, pairing them with a veteran mentor and giving them a paid eight-week creative boot
continuation:
camp. Now, Im hearing from this years program participants, who are getting ready for next months cohort, that theyll get a week of hands-on creative coaching, as well.

Whats really unique is that when people are learning, theyre going to get time-intensive coaching. Not everybody is going to get a six-minute critique, which is fine. But what were also offering is something else, which is hands-on coaching, says Iain MacLean, the programs co-creator. The goal is for people to get more direct input from a mentoring relationship with someone whos been working in television for more than 30 years. But MacLean says its also important for participants to gain more direct input from someone with decades of experience, if they want to get into the world of TV. I think its important to put people in places where, as writers, sometimes its hard for them to think about or think of something creatively, he says. Not only are they going to get support from people with more
paraphrase:
Imagine Impact is launching its second mentoring program, building on the success of last year's initiative. This year's program will offer participants a unique blend of hands-on coaching and direct input from experienced mentors. According to Iain MacLean, co-creator of the program, "We're committed to providing our mentees with the highest quality support and guidance as they develop their craft."
Unlike last year's program, which focused on a paid eight-week creative bootcamp, this year's mentoring program will include a week of hands-on coaching. MacLean believes that this approach will provide participants with more direct input and support from experienced mentors. "We want to help our mentees gain more confidence and creativity in their writing," he explains. "By providing them with hands-on coaching, we can give them the opportunity to learn from someone with decades of experience in the industry."
MacLean emphasizes that the program is not just about providing quick fixes or six-minute critiques. Rather, it's about giving participants the time and support they need to develop their skills and achieve their goals. "We want to put our mentees in places where they can thrive and grow as writers," he says. "By providing them with hands-on coaching and direct input from experienced mentors, we can help them reach their full potential in the world of TV."

input: TUCSON, Ariz. (AP) Arizona was shaky with the ball early, had trouble getting shots to fall from the perimeter. With a roster full of new players and old players in new roles, it was kind of expected.
continuation:
And yet, Arizona managed to beat No. 14 Southern California 82-74 on Sunday, rallying from a 12-point deficit in the second half to stay unbeaten in the Pac-12.

I think were growing, Arizona coach Sean Miller said. I think this is what it should look like, I think this is where it should be, I think these are the times where its going to get tougher. Were going to find ways to win. I think this is what this team is going to be like.

Matt Thomas led six Arizona players in double figures with 20 points, making 7 of 11 shots. Chasson Randle had 17 points and nine rebounds. Jevon Carter, the only returning starter from a team that went 30-6 overall and 14-0 in league play, added 14 points.

I feel like this was one of our more complete victories in Pac-12 play, Arizona guard Nico Mannion said. Its really big to us.

The Wildcats (11-1, 3-0) came into the game ranked No. 23 in
paraphrase:
Tuscon, Arizona (AP) - Arizona faced early challenges with their ball handling and perimeter shooting, but managed to pull off a thrilling comeback victory against No. 14 Southern California. Despite having a new-look roster with many players in new roles, the Wildcats managed to stay unbeaten in the Pac-12 with an 82-74 win.
Coach Sean Miller praised his team's resilience and growth, saying that this is what the team is capable of. Matt Thomas led the team in double digits with 20 points, followed by Chasson Randle with 17 points and 9 rebounds. Jevon Carter, the only returning starter from last year's 30-6 team, added 14 points.
Nico Mannion, one of the new players, was pleased with the team's performance, calling it one of their more complete victories in Pac-12 play. With this win, Arizona improves to 11-1 overall and 3-0 in the conference.

input:
Former Paterson Mayor Pat Kramer reflects on the crises facing Paterson in the wake of Joey Torres' resignation.
In light of the plea agreement made by now former Paterson Mayor Joey Torres, I was asked to reflect on the future of my beloved
continuation:
city. It is with trepidation I am writing this, but this city is in dire straits and I believe its only a matter of time before it is destroyed.
Im especially thinking of the neighborhoods of Patterson, which are in desperate need of improvement, and of the people of Paterson, whose lives are in need of protection. Im also thinking of all of our teachers, city employees, police officers, firemen, busboys, barbers, barwomen, city officials, and of many of our other citizens. Our city is in dire need of investment in public transportation, in order to meet growing needs in traffic, in transportation options, in transportation needs. It is a crisis that is not being properly addressed. It is only going to get worse if current policies are allowed to continue.
In light of these circumstances, I am making this offer: I will step aside, if elected, as mayor of Paterson, if I am willing to help facilitate a change in the citys policies that will help us improve our transportation options. As mayor, Ill help in any way I can with a change in transportation policy, especially in order to alleviate traffic congestion
paraphrase:
Former Paterson Mayor Pat Kramer assesses the current state of Paterson following Joey Torres' resignation and proposes a potential solution to address the city's transportation needs.
In light of the recent plea agreement reached by former Mayor Joey Torres, I am compelled to reflect on the future of my beloved Paterson. The city is facing unprecedented challenges, and I fear that without swift action, it may succumb to the depths of despair. The neighborhoods of Paterson, in particular, require urgent attention, as they continue to struggle with inadequate resources and infrastructure. The lives of our citizens, including our teachers, city employees, police officers, firefighters, and everyday working people, are in dire need of protection and support.
To combat this crisis, I propose a bold initiative: I am willing to step aside as mayor of Paterson if elected, and work towards implementing policies that prioritize the improvement of our public transportation systems. As mayor, I will leverage my influence to facilitate a change in transportation policy, with a particular focus on alleviating the city's notorious traffic congestion. This is not a partisan issue; rather, it is a matter of prioritizing the needs of our citizens and ensuring that Paterson remains a vibrant and thriving metropolis.
I urge my fellow citizens to join me in this quest for a better future, one that prioritizes the well-being and prosperity of our beloved city. Together, we can overcome the challenges facing Paterson and build a brighter tomorrow for ourselves and future generations.

input: Elaine Tieber and the doctor joke back and forth as he examines the small brown spots on her back. The doctor, Thomas Goleman, brims with a folksy, Southern manner, and Tieber has a sense of humor to match
continuation:
. He is in a bad mood. "You are too bright for me, Elaine. I think I've done all I could do. I've tried. I've done what I've been asked to do." He goes on to tell her what he thinks she did well, and her performance, but "I don't understand why I didn't see it. I never saw it."

A new book of stories, "Fifty-five Minutes in Your Body" (Penguin Random House) will hit bookstores in October, but what are these stories? Are they really stories or are they in fact medical facts? "Fifty-five Minutes in Your Body" is, in many ways, a medical history of modern medicine. It is also in many ways just plain funny. The book is divided into four sections: "My Body Is Not Your Body" "My Body is Your Body" "My Body is Not Your Body" "My Body is Not Your Body" "My Body is Not Your Body" "My Body is Not Your Body"

These sections range from a medical history of modern medicine to stories of doctor-patient exchanges with stories of medical misadventures, like "Dr. A-F
paraphrase:
Elaine Tieber and the doctor, Thomas Goleman, bantered back and forth as he examined the small brown spots on her back. Goleman had a folksy, Southern demeanor, while Tieber's sense of humor matched his. Despite his friendly nature, Goleman appeared in a foul mood. "You are too intelligent for me, Elaine. I think I've done all I could do. I've tried my best, but it seems I've failed," he said, highlighting her impressive performance and what he believed she had achieved. However, he expressed confusion, "I never understood why I couldn't see it. I never saw it coming."
A newly released book, "Fifty-five Minutes in Your Body" (Penguin Random House), promises to deliver intriguing stories, but are they truly stories or medical facts? This book is essentially a medical history of modern medicine, but it also serves as a humorous collection of anecdotes. The book is divided into four sections: "My Body Is Not Your Body," "My Body Is Your Body," "My Body Is Not Your Body," and "My Body Is Not Your Body." These sections range from a medical history of modern medicine to lighthearted accounts of doctor-patient interactions, including amusing medical mishaps, such as "Dr. A-F's Blunder."

input:
QUEENSLAND'S police minster has said the violent home invasions in Murgon last weekend were not targeted.
Mark Ryan said further police resources were immediately deployed to the area over the weekend after the Murgon police prosecutor
continuation:
issued warrants for six people following a seven-hour spree.
"Police resources were immediately deployed. The police prosecutor was successful in obtaining seven warrants, one of which was of arrest, which were executed in relation to these alleged offenders, Mr Ryan said.
"Police resources are deployed in relation to ongoing investigations into these crimes. We will also continue to work closely with Crime Stoppers."
In a statement released on Facebook this morning, police revealed that six men were arrested, one of whom is due in court today.
paraphrase: The Queensland Police Minister has confirmed that the recent home invasions in Murgon were not orchestrated, despite the issuance of warrants for six individuals by the local prosecutor. Immediately after the weekend incidents, additional police resources were deployed to the area to support ongoing investigations. The prosecutor successfully obtained seven warrants, including one for arrest, which were executed in relation to the alleged offenders, according to Minister Ryan. As part of their ongoing efforts, police are continuing to collaborate closely with Crime Stoppers. This morning, police announced that six men were taken into custody, with one of them scheduled to appear in court today.

input:
Argentina labor's umbrella organization CGT, has organized a strike for Monday to protest the economic reforms being implemented y the administration of president Mauricio Macri's business friendly administration.
Tens of thousands of people have marched on Saturday in central
continuation:
Buenos Aires, where many of the new laws were approved, while hundreds of thousands more are expected in the provinces. The strike will extend from the Argentine capital to other major cities around the country. The strike was called following government-imposed bus service cuts.
In the provinces, protesters will demonstrate in cities like Buenos Aires, Salta, Mendoza, Tucumn, Santa Cruz, Ro Negro, Cordoba, Neuquen, Cordoba, Chubut, Chubut, Santa Cruz, Santa Cruz, Chubut, Cordoba, Neuquen, Chubut, Chubut, Chubut, Salta, Chubut, Ro Negro, Ro Negro, Chubut, Chubut, Neuquen, Neuquen, Chubut, Chubut, Chubut, Neuquen, Chubut, Ro Negro, Ro Negro, Chubut, Ro Negro, Chubut, Neuquen, Neuquen, Ro Negro, Ro Negro, Chubut, Neuquen, Neuquen, Chubut,
paraphrase: The Argentine labor union, CGT, is organizing a strike on Monday to protest the economic reforms being implemented by the Macri administration. Thousands of people marched in Buenos Aires on Saturday, with hundreds of thousands more expected to join the strike in provinces across the country. The protests are a response to government-mandated bus service cuts, and will extend from the capital to other major cities. The strike is a call to action against the business-friendly policies of the Macri administration, which have had a significant impact on the economy and everyday lives of Argentinians.

input:
Julia M. Carpenter, a sophomore in chemical engineering, was found dead in her Random Hall dormitory room early Monday morning. She was 20 years old.
Carpenter was a member of Alpha Chi Sigma (AXE), a professional chemistry
continuation:
club, and was a member of Kappa Kappa Psi (Kappa Kappa), also a professional chemistry club.
A news release from Kappa Kappa Psi states, "Kappa Kappa Psi members are deeply saddened and deeply concerned to learn of Julias tragic passing. We are working with her parents, her brothers, her father-in-law, mother-in-law, and extended family in order to understand the circumstances surrounding her death. This tragic news is devastating, especially for her father-in-law, Michael J. Carpenter."
"Kappa Kappa Psi members extend our heartfelt sympathies to her father-in-law, Michael, and his mother, Julie," stated Kappa Kappa Psi Executive Board Chairperson, Paul Chieffo. "We stand in solidarity with them and share in their grief."
A visitation is set for Tuesday, April 9, from 11:00 am to 1:00 pm, followed by a funeral service from 1:00 pm-3:00 pm in Alpha Chi Sigma. A time will also be available for an individual gathering with her friends, if any. A private burial is planned. A funeral home will provide further details. A Facebook event has been set up
paraphrase:
Julia M. Carpenter, a sophomore chemical engineering student, was tragically found dead in her Random Hall dorm room early Monday morning. She was just 20 years old.
As a member of Alpha Chi Sigma (AXE) and Kappa Kappa Psi (Kappa Kappa), Julia was an active and dedicated member of the professional chemistry clubs. Her friends and fellow club members are devastated by her untimely passing.
A joint statement from Kappa Kappa Psi Executive Board Chairperson, Paul Chieffo, expressed the organization's deepest sympathies to Julia's father-in-law, Michael, and his mother, Julie, during this difficult time. "We stand in solidarity with them and share in their grief," Chieffo added.
A visitation will be held on Tuesday, April 9, from 11:00 am to 1:00 pm, followed by a funeral service from 1:00 pm-3:00 pm in Alpha Chi Sigma. Friends and loved ones are also invited to a private gathering at a later time. A funeral home will provide further details.
In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in Julia's memory to the Julia M. Carpenter Memorial Fund, which will support chemical engineering scholarships in her honor. A Facebook event has been set up for those who wish to pay their respects and share their condolences.

input:
Treasury Secretary Mnuchin applauded Walmart for raising its starting hourly wage.
"We thought that [tax cuts] would be great for the economy and we are thrilled with the number of companies reacting accordingly," he said Thursday.
Mnuchin also
continuation:
said he expects "some other announcements" from other retailers. The retailer is reportedly expected to announce it will raise its base wage to $11 an hour later this week.
"A lot of companies are already thinking about doing this. A couple are going to announce it tomorrow. I think this is going to accelerate," he said. "And it will drive wages up."
paraphrase: Treasury Secretary Mnuchin praised Walmart for increasing its minimum hourly wage, expressing satisfaction that the company is taking action in response to the recent tax cuts. During a press conference on Thursday, Mnuchin noted that he expects other retailers to follow suit and announce similar wage increases in the near future. He highlighted the potential for wages to rise as more companies take action to invest in their employees and contribute to overall economic growth.

input:
He is the first Gautier athlete to sign a Division I scholarship in five years.
Pringle did not know where he would play for the Braves, who won the SWAC championship this year. "I want to play where I can
continuation:
get my opportunity to win. If I was going to choose, I would choose them."
Pringle said he was more intrigued with his new school in Tallahassee than his hometown in Gautier, where he played for Georgia Southern. Pringle said he was also impressed with the coaching staff. "I heard Coach (Matt) Mullins is really, really good. I've heard great things about Coach (Chris) Rumph, too. I feel like I'm going to learn a lot here." Pringle said Mullins, who spent six seasons with the Blue Jackets, recruited him. "I feel like I'm going to learn a lot here. Coach Rumph said he was going to try his best, too. I feel like I'm going to learn a lot. Coach (Tony) Rumph is really, really good." Pringle said he enjoyed his previous year with Georgia Southern. He enjoyed his time with his teammates. "I made some really good friends. I really enjoyed it. We played really hard, and it was fun. I loved it here."
The Blue Jackets were 6-11 overall in Pringle's final season. He was named second-team All-SWAC this season.
paraphrase: Pringle is the first athlete from Gautier to secure a Division I scholarship in five years. He remains undecided on which team he will play for, but his desire is to compete for a championship. Pringle expresses admiration for his new school in Tallahassee, citing the impressive coaching staff as a major draw. He notes that Coach Matt Mullins has an excellent reputation, as does Coach Chris Rumph. Pringle is eager to learn from these coaches and feels that he will have the opportunity to do so. Mullins, who spent six seasons with the Blue Jackets, recruited Pringle, and he is confident in the coach's ability to help him improve. Pringle enjoyed his time at Georgia Southern, where he made lasting friendships with his teammates. He describes his experience as enjoyable and challenging, with a team that played hard and had fun. Despite the team's 6-11 overall record in his final season, Pringle was recognized as a second-team All-SWAC selection.

input: CANBERRA, Australia -- A four-year search of the depths of the Indian Ocean has failed to find Malaysia Airlines Flight 370. But the unprecedented sonar hunt for the missing airliner might be close to solving 19th century mysteries - the locations of
continuation:
its "pilot" air-traffic control communications with air traffic controllers.

After 19 days of searching, Malaysia has failed to find the jetliner. A massive underwater hunt has failed. But it seems certain that somewhere in the vast ocean, somewhere on the southern tip of India, are signals from the flight.

Experts say the signals could be from a single pilot radio or from multiple pilots. The problem is figuring out which.

An automated communications system called Automatic Identification System (AIS) is required in commercial planes. The AIS transmits information about its location, position, heading and speed, giving air traffic controllers, pilots, satellite or phone-company trackers the ability to find it in the worst case scenario.

"AIS is sort of like a modern-day radio beacon," said Andrew Murphy, a professor of modern history and international relations at Monash University. "It gives controllers of planes, air traffic controllers, satellite providers, any number of entities in control, information about where it is. If it is located, it gives you more options."

In the worst-case scenario, if AIS can determine which aircraft it is, it allows air traffic controllers to switch from one
paraphrase:
CANBERRA, Australia - After an extensive four-year search of the Indian Ocean, Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 remains elusive. Despite the unprecedented sonar hunt, the location of the missing airliner remains a mystery. However, the search may be closer to solving 19th century enigmas - the whereabouts of the pilot's air-traffic control communications.
Experts believe the signals could be from a single pilot's radio or multiple pilots, and deciphering the messages requires careful analysis. Automatic Identification System (AIS), a crucial technology for commercial planes, could provide vital information in the worst-case scenario, allowing air traffic controllers to locate the aircraft.
Andrew Murphy, a professor of modern history and international relations at Monash University, explains, "AIS is like a modern-day radio beacon, providing controllers with information on the plane's location, position, heading, and speed. This allows satellite providers, air traffic controllers, and other entities to track the aircraft in real-time."
In the worst-case scenario, if AIS can determine which aircraft it is, air traffic controllers can employ additional measures to locate the plane.

The E-notation means that you should multiply the constant by 10 raised to the power following the "E". Hence, 2.0E6 is two million, while 3.333E-1 is approximately one third.
Here 2.0
continuation: e6 is expressed in decimal format, ie. (2.0e6) * 0.0018 which is (1/6) + (0.0018) + (0.0018) where 1/6 is six decimal places. That is the way it is in almost all languages. It was introduced into languages like Java, Python, Ruby, PHP, and many other languages, with the intention of making calculations easier. For example, when writing decimal-formatted numerical values, you only need to multiply it by 1/6. If you use other types of languages, it is often difficult to get into the habit of writing 1/6 instead of 1/6. This is also why it is important to understand that the "1/6" of decimal notation is not "1/6 of 1/6", but 1/6 of 1/6. For instance, in English, 1/6 of 1/6 or 1/6 of 1/6 of one is used in multiplication, while 1/6 of 1/6 of one is used in subtraction. As an alternative, in Java, Java-1/6 notation is used. It is also common practice in other languages, even
paraphrase:
The E-notation is a shorthand notation that involves multiplying a constant by 10 raised to a power. For example, 2.0E6 represents two million, while 3.333E-1 represents approximately one third.
In decimal format, the E-notation can be expressed as (2.0E6) * 0.0018, which is equivalent to (1/6) + (0.0018) + (0.0018). This is a common convention in many programming languages, including Java, Python, Ruby, and PHP, among others. The idea behind this notation is to make calculations easier by reducing the number of digits required for decimal values.
It is important to note that the "1/6" in decimal notation refers to the number of significant digits, not the actual value of the number. For example, in English, 1/6 of 1/6 or 1/6 of 1/6 of one is used in multiplication, while 1/6 of 1/6 of one is used in subtraction.
Alternatively, Java-1/6 notation is used in some programming languages to represent decimal values. This notation is similar to the E-notation, but it uses a different format for representing decimal values.

input: A police chase that began in Norwalk early this morning ended in Des Moines as the man being chased jumped to his death from a parking ramp. Norwalk Police Chief Eddie Kuhl says it began with a call of a person who was possibly suicidal who
continuation: was jumping off of a Norwalk apartment balcony. The caller was unsure whether or not the man was armed, so Norwalk police called police in Des Moines, who took him in. The man was being kept in custody until he jumped off of a Norwalk ramp around 8:40 this morning. Kuhl says it happened in the area of 51st Street. He says, when he tried to help, he was hit in the head with a brick. He was taken to the hospital where he later died. Investigators found a gun in his possession, but havent recovered it yet. No names have been released. The mans death is under investigation.
paraphrase: A dramatic pursuit that began in Norwalk early this morning ended in Des Moines with the individual being chased taking his own life by jumping from a parking structure. According to Norwalk Police Chief Eddie Kuhl, the incident started with a distress call regarding a potentially suicidal person leaping from an apartment balcony in Norwalk. Due to the uncertainty about the individual's arms status, Norwalk police immediately contacted their counterparts in Des Moines, who apprehended the person. The individual was being held in custody until they jumped from a parking structure in the vicinity of 51st Street around 8:40 this morning. Kuhl stated that when he tried to intervene, he was struck in the head with a brick. He was subsequently taken to the hospital, where he sadly passed away. A firearm was found in the person's possession, although it has not yet been retrieved. Authorities have not released the individual's identity at this time. The incident is currently under investigation.

input:
A group of Motherwell fans staged a protest outside the main stand against Mark McGhees management of the team during the Steelmens 5-1 defeat at home to Dundee.
Well are only three points off the bottom
continuation:
of the table, with McGhees side having picked up just one win from six matches under his reign.
A petition calling for McGhee to step down  which is still growing in popularity  was signed by 100 people. The fans chanted "we want McGhee out" in response to his recent interview where he expressed his frustration with the club's state of play.
McGhee's time at Fir Park will end when his contract expires in January, unless he is willing to extend it. It is expected McGhee will not want to re-sign with the Steelmen, with his tenure in his home town being turbulent.
paraphrase:
A contingent of Motherwell supporters organized a demonstration near the main stand to express their discontent with Mark McGhee's leadership of the team during their 5-1 home defeat against Dundee.
The team is currently placed only three spots above the relegation zone, with McGhee's squad having earned only one victory in their last six matches under his tenure.
In response to his recent interview, where he voiced his frustration with the team's current state of affairs, the fans chanted, "We want McGhee out!"
McGhee's time at Fir Park is set to come to an end in January, when his contract expires, unless he decides to renew it. It is likely that McGhee will not want to extend his contract, given the turbulent nature of his tenure in the town.

input:
When a South Carolina man found a Waffle House's only employee asleep, he decided to make the food himself.
Alex Bowen was returning from a night of drinking when he visited the restaurant to satisfy an early-morning food craving.
He waited
continuation:
in line, which took him longer than usual, with his friend, and was served within minutes. He placed his order, which included french fries, his usual drinks, and a few biscuits, while he waited. A few minutes later, he noticed someone else in his spot, ordering something else. He sat next to him and began drinking. A bit later, he noticed he was sleeping.
Bowen, 26, of Orangeburg, SC, said he didn't wake up until he heard someone else in his place order something. Then he heard someone else go into the bathroom. He saw a sign above the bathroom, which said Waffle House closed. Then he heard someone get into his car. After he got back in his car, he heard someone else drive away.
Bowen was disappointed when he found Waffle House was closed, but he didn't think much of it. Then he noticed, in the window, a sign that said "closest Waffle House is in Columbia." He called the police station, where he was assured someone would be available. He called 911, and, when he called back, he was given directions to Waffle House, according to KSP.
The nearest Waffle House is
paraphrase:
When a South Carolina man stumbled upon a Waffle House with only the sleeping employee, he decided to whip up his own meal.
Alex Bowen was on his way back from a night of drinking when he stopped by the restaurant to satisfy his early-morning food cravings. He waited in line for an extended period, accompanied by his friend, and was served within minutes. He placed his order, which included crispy fries, his favorite drinks, and a handful of warm biscuits, while he waited. A brief interval later, he observed an unfamiliar face in his spot, ordering something different. He opted to sit next to the stranger and indulge in his drinks. Shortly after, he noticed the stranger had fallen asleep.
Bowen, a 26-year-old from Orangeburg, SC, revealed that he didn't stir until he heard someone else claim his spot and order something else. He then heard someone entering the restroom. Upon glancing up at the sign above the bathroom, he noticed that Waffle House had closed. Moments later, he spotted someone getting into his vehicle. After he got back in his car, he heard the sound of another car driving away.
Bowen was taken aback when he discovered that Waffle House was closed, but he didn't think much of it. However, he soon spotted a sign in the window, which stated that the closest Waffle House was located in Columbia. He contacted the local police station, where he was assured that someone would be available. He dialed 911, and when he called back, he was given directions to Waffle House, as per the KSP.
The nearest Waffle House is located in Columbia.

input:
The Senate is in a standoff regarding bills that would send relief funding to Puerto Rico, which is still recovering from Hurricane Maria.
On Monday (April 1), a measure was defeated in the Senate to provide disaster relief for Puerto Rico. Democrats voted against
continuation:
the bill, which was backed by majority Republicans. The Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said Democrats were refusing to pass a measure without an emergency provision, which he argued is necessary in order to expedite emergency aid.
In an interview with Fox News Bill Hemmer, Senate Majority Whip John Cornyn (R-TX) expressed his opinion of Democrats stance. I think its been a little bit more partisan, he said. I dont think its been based on whats in the bill.
"I think it's been more partisan."  Senator John Cornyn (@SenJohnCornyn) April 1, 2019
Although Senate Democrats did agree to send money to Puerto Rico, they did so only under one condition: Republicans pass an emergency spending bill, which is currently under negotiations. Senate Democrats want emergency funds available from the federal government in order to provide aid, while majority Republicans want aid from Congress. Senator Marco Rubio (R-FL) even said, in response, "we are going to get money to help Puerto Rico."
"And if we get Congress money, well try and get the House of Representatives to
paraphrase: The political impasse in the Senate over relief funding for Puerto Rico has intensified, with both sides digging in their heels. Democrats are adamant that any aid package must be passed without an emergency provision, while Republicans argue that it is necessary to expedite relief efforts. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has criticized Democrats for their stance, labeling it partisan and unbased on the contents of the bill. Despite this, Senate Democrats have agreed to send money to Puerto Rico, but only if Republicans pass an emergency spending bill, which is currently under negotiation. The standoff has led to a heated exchange of words between lawmakers, with Senator Marco Rubio (R-FL) vowing to secure funding for Puerto Rico.

input: Globalization has transformed the Indian business landscape into a dynamic field, with entrepreneurs and professionals constantly being challenged by emerging trends, new business models and technological breakthroughs. In order to keep up with the changing demands of the business world, professionals are now opting
continuation:
for foreign education.
With rising internationalization, countries like India are now attracting more multinational corporations (MNCs) and foreign direct investment (FDI) into India. To further bolster Indias economy, foreign education institutions are also working to increase their business operations in India. The Indias Business School Network (IBNS), a group of 20 private sector colleges located in six cities across India, aims to provide foreign education opportunities for Indias youth. IBNS also aims to provide new education models, new learning experiences, and provide a new set of challenges.
Federating with international organizations like the International Business Schools Association (Ibsa), IBNS is also working to offer new education programs. The IBSAs new Education Master programs include Global Business Management (GBM) and The Future of International Business (FTIB).
IBNS will also partner with international organizations like Ibsa, Ibsa India (IIS) and Ibsa Japan (IJS), said Tapan Ray, Associate Vice President of IBNS, India. The IBNS Education Master programs will help professionals from India gain international level competency in a business setting.
IBNS international
paraphrase:
Globalization has revolutionized the Indian business landscape, presenting entrepreneurs and professionals with a dynamic environment where they must adapt to emerging trends, innovative business models, and technological advancements. In response, many are choosing to pursue foreign education to stay ahead of the curve.
India's increasing attractiveness to multinational corporations (MNCs) and foreign direct investment (FDI) is a testament to the country's growing economic prowess. As a result, foreign education institutions are expanding their operations in India to tap into the country's vast talent pool.
The Indias Business School Network (IBNS), a consortium of 20 private sector colleges located across six Indian cities, is at the forefront of this trend. IBNS aims to provide foreign education opportunities to India's youth while offering new educational models, unique learning experiences, and challenges.
To achieve this goal, IBNS is forging partnerships with international organizations such as the International Business Schools Association (Ibsa) and Ibsa India (IIS). These collaborations will enable IBNS to offer cutting-edge education programs, including the Global Business Management (GBM) and The Future of International Business (FTIB) Master programs.
Tapan Ray, Associate Vice President of IBNS, India, notes that the IBNS Education Master programs will equip professionals from India with the international competence required to excel in a business environment.
By partnering with leading international organizations, IBNS is positioning itself as a hub for foreign education in India, offering a platform for professionals to gain the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in the global marketplace.

input:
Olympic champions Heather Stanning and Helen Glover said they were relieved to win their first world title together after a difficult season.
Stanning, 29, struggled with fatigue after regaining her spot in the team following a stint in the Army,
continuation:
and Glover, 28, took time off following injury. But despite their injuries, Stanning said it was always her intention to win the world titles together.
It was something I never really had to think about in terms of where we were going to end up, Stanning said. I was always going to look to go one or two places over.
Stanning was hurt during a training session in August while her partner Glover was preparing for her world championship debut in Brazil. The injury was the third of her career.
Its been quite frustrating in terms of wanting to race, she said. My other injuries have been minor. This time it was really painful.
Stanning said she suffered her first back injury in early 2008 while competing in the US national championships. But after returning to racing, she was injured while preparing for her world championships debut in Brazil. Stanning suffered more back injuries while preparing for her 2016 Rio Olympics. Both she and Glover are from Vancouver, British Columbia.
After regaining her place in the team, Stanning said she suffered another back injury while preparing for her 2018 world championship debut in Russia. It was one
paraphrase:
Olympic gold medalists Heather Stanning and Helen Glover expressed their relief after securing their first world title together following a challenging season. Stanning, 29, had to overcome fatigue after returning to the team following a stint in the Army, while Glover, 28, took time off due to injury. Despite their setbacks, Stanning maintained that it was always her intention to win world titles with Glover.
Stanning suffered a back injury during a training session in August, her third injury in total, which left her frustrated as she was unable to race. "It's been quite frustrating, wanting to race, but my other injuries have been minor. This time it was really painful," she said.
Stanning's first back injury occurred in early 2008 while competing in the US national championships, and she experienced further injuries while preparing for her 2016 Rio Olympics. Both Stanning and Glover are from Vancouver, British Columbia.
After regaining her place in the team, Stanning suffered another back injury while preparing for her 2018 world championship debut in Russia.

input:
Fairfield Countys history is now more accurately recorded. A group of hardworking individuals volunteered to work together to re-trace Zanes Trace.
Fairfield Countys history is now more accurately recorded. A group
continuation:
of hardworking individuals volunteered to work together to re-trace Zanes Trace.
Zanes Trace is a place of honor in the history of Fairfield County. It is named after Zane Reynolds, one of the founders of The Farmington Free School. He was one of the first settlers, and served as mayor in The Farmington Free School. Reynolds was also the editor of The Farmington Herald. This document was used to guide people in The Farmington Free School. He was killed in a shooting in Boston, Massachusetts. Reynolds, his wife Sarah, and his young son Zane came to this area from Virginia. Zane was born in The Farmington Free School.
Zanes Trace was re-established in 2018. It is located in The Farmington Historic district. The Farmington Historic district was created in 1926, making it one of the oldest communities in Connecticut. It is also one of the largest historic communities in Connecticut. Zanes Trace was in need of re-attestation. The first Zanes Trace was located in The Farmington Free School. It was destroyed in 1906. The second Zanes Trace was also located in The
paraphrase:
Fairfield County's historical record has been significantly improved thanks to the efforts of a dedicated group of individuals. They worked together to retrace Zanes Trace, a place of great historical significance in the county.
Zanes Trace is a symbol of honor in Fairfield County's history, named after Zane Reynolds, one of the founders of The Farmington Free School. He was a pioneer settler, serving as mayor of The Farmington Free School and editor of The Farmington Herald. Tragically, he was killed in a shooting in Boston, Massachusetts. Reynolds, his wife Sarah, and their young son Zane migrated from Virginia to the area. Zane was born in The Farmington Free School.
In 2018, Zanes Trace was re-established in The Farmington Historic District, which was created in 1926, making it one of the oldest communities in Connecticut and one of the largest historic districts in the state. The original Zanes Trace was lost in 1906, and the second Zanes Trace was also located in The Farmington Free School.
By retracing Zanes Trace, this dedicated group has helped preserve Fairfield County's rich history for future generations.

The new baby will bring the total number of grandchildren in the Smith household to 18, joining their six biological children and five stepchildren. input:
Sharp saw sales drop 12 percent in the nine months to December as competition increased in the LCD panel and television markets, it said Wednesday.
The company saw demand for flat-screen TVs drop in markets outside of Japan and was also pinched by price
continuation:
cuts in Europe.
"It is too early to say whether Japan will be immune from the slowdown in world trade," Masahiro Sakai, Sharp president, said in a statement. "In the meantime, Sharp is focusing on adjusting its business, which is more efficient, to cope with rising costs. That should put us in a better position."
Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Malaysia, the United States and China are Sharp's top markets.
Sharp said its annual net profit declined 6.8 percent in the year ended March 31. It also set a new interim profit target of 140 billion yen, below what analysts were expecting.
The company said its shipments of liquid crystal displays were affected by factors including softening demand in Asia and weak economies in Europe. Shipments of liquid crystal displays in Europe were hurt by a shift in television production from the continent.
Sharp said it expects its net profit this year will more than double. But it warned its profits will fall in the first half of next year.
Japan Display, which is currently led by its chairman, will report its second-quarter earnings in April.
paraphrase:
Sharp saw a 12% decline in sales over the last nine months, mainly due to increased competition in the LCD panel and TV markets. The company experienced a decrease in demand for flat-screen TVs in markets outside of Japan and was also affected by price cuts in Europe.
According to Sharp President Masahiro Sakai, it is uncertain whether Japan will be immune to the slowdown in global trade, but the company is focusing on adjusting its business to cope with rising costs. This will position Sharp better in the future.
Sharp's top markets include Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Malaysia, the United States, and China. The company's annual net profit decreased by 6.8% in the year ended March 31, and it set a new interim profit target of 140 billion yen, below analyst expectations.
Sharp's shipments of liquid crystal displays were impacted by softening demand in Asia and weak economies in Europe. The shift of television production from Europe also hurt shipments of liquid crystal displays in Europe.
Despite the current challenges, Sharp expects its net profit to more than double this year. However, the company warned that profits will fall in the first half of next year. Japan Display, which is led by its chairman, will report its second-quarter earnings in April.

input:
The glaring contradiction in Greeces government is producing a political crisis.
Left wing party Syriza was elected on an anti-austerity programme and now it is implementing the worst austerity measures yet.
To win a majority in parliament it is
continuation:
attempting to change the partys policies to appeal to its base. But its policies are being rejected, and it has declared itself in rebellion. The Greek people are rising in anger.
You may call me a fascist, says German Chancellor Angela Merkel, when she was asked in one of her recent news conferences if she thought Syriza was racist.
I dont think you are fascist, says Syriza leader Alexis Tsipras when she is asked if he is racist. We are social democratic. We dont think it is racist when we say, We want jobs. We dont think it is racist when we say, We want respect.
Read more
In one sense, Syriza is far from racist. For centuries, it has been a party of civil rights  its members are diverse: Muslims, Jews, Roma, Syriac Orthodox Christians, and so on. It stands firmly against discrimination, in fact, with its record of opposing discrimination from the time of its inception.
 Syriza was also one of the first political parties in Greece which took an anti-austerity stance. It
paraphrase:
The discrepancy within Greece's government has sparked a political impasse.
The left-wing Syriza party, elected on a platform of anti-austerity measures, has now implemented harsher budget cuts than any of its predecessors. In an attempt to win majority support in parliament, the party is reassessing its stance to appeal to its base, but these new policies are being met with resistance and defiance from the Greek people.
German Chancellor Angela Merkel has accused Syriza of racism during a recent press conference, to which Syriza leader Alexis Tsipras responded by emphasizing the party's commitment to social democracy.
While some may view Syriza as lacking in racism, the party has a long history of advocating for civil rights and boasts a diverse membership consisting of Muslims, Jews, Roma, and Syriac Orthodox Christians. Syriza has consistently stood against discrimination, and was one of the first political parties in Greece to take a stance against austerity measures.

input:
Before there was television, there was radio.
TV took radios shows, sponsors and many of its stars. It took the concept of networks, the 30-minute time slot and theme songs.
It duplicated most of radio
continuation:
programs. And it made money off of them.
More people are listening to radio now. But, radio still attracts more money. The bottom line, says Mike Johnson, executive vice president of the Radio Hall of Fame, is that radio is profitable, while television is not. (I wrote this feature in 1996, in the inaugural edition of Broadcasting & Cable, a trade-show brochure. As is often the case with me, it has sat with me in a box for many years. But I just havent found the time, money or energy to read it. But it is still here, in its pristine form, in its printed, yellow-covered, fold-over-the-edge-but-not-too-fold-over shape.)
Im glad I was able to look at the data of these two industries, and compare them, without losing any of my analytical abilities. It helped me appreciate both radio, and television. It made me more humble about television, which is what I often think of when I hear talk-radio hosts making fun of it.
I also think of all of the radio talent, from Bob Hope, to Paul Shaffer, to Charlie Rose, to
paraphrase:
Prior to the advent of television, radio was the primary medium for entertainment and information dissemination. Television, however, quickly encroached upon radio's territory, absorbing its content, sponsors, and even some of its celebrated personalities. Despite this, radio has continued to thrive, with a dedicated listener base that extends to this day. In fact, according to Mike Johnson, executive vice president of the Radio Hall of Fame, radio remains more profitable than television. This is evident in the sheer volume of radio programming that continues to attract a sizable audience, despite the emergence of television as a competing medium.
While examining the data of these two industries, I gained a newfound appreciation for the distinct strengths of each. Radio's intimate, personal nature allows for a deeper connection with listeners, while television's visual element enables a more immersive experience. This perspective has also made me more cognizant of the talented individuals who have graced both mediums, including the likes of Bob Hope, Paul Shaffer, Charlie Rose, and many more.
