input:
They were once seen as the preserve of the geek, but nowadays personal opinion and diary pages - weblogs or "blogs" - are so powerful that huge corporations are taking an interest.
The sites that started as observational home pages for enthusiasts have become
continuation:
much more interesting places where even everyday office workers have a voice.
The rise of blogs is creating a new class of socialites, some of them making money blogging from home, while others are more or less freelancing.
Some of these people are making money just from blogging, while others are creating valuable information.
And just like any creative medium, blogging is transforming. The rise of "bloggers" in the United States is reflected in new job opportunities. As many of us are aware, blogging began in Japan in 2003, when many people began making money blogging as hobby.
Most of us also are aware of other countries, including Britain, where blogging became popular in 2007. But in the United States, blogging in 2007 was mainly seen in Japan, where it is commonly called jikji (pronounced jik in Japanese) or kanjiyoblogging.
"Bloggers" was only the beginning. Today, blogging is also seen in other countries, especially in Britain, where the website The Digital Press, which runs The Digital Press. com, is the first in a series of British newspapers with similar Internet offerings.
Other newspapers, like The Times, also offer blogging. I will tell you more
paraphrase:
The once obscure realm of personal opinion and diary pages, or weblogs, have become a mainstream phenomenon, captivating the attention of major corporations. From humble beginnings as enthusiasts' observational homepages, these platforms have evolved into dynamic spaces where everyday individuals can express their voices.
The rise of blogging has given rise to a new breed of socialites, some of whom are profiting from their online presence, while others are freelancing their skills. This shift has created new job opportunities, with the United States being a prominent example. Blogging, which originated in Japan in 2003, has since gained popularity globally, including in Britain, where it became a mainstream phenomenon in 2007.
In the United States, blogging has become an integral part of the digital landscape, with many newspapers and websites offering blogging platforms. The Digital Press, a British newspaper, is at the forefront of this trend, offering a range of digital services. Other publications, such as The Times, are also embracing blogging, further solidifying its place in the media landscape.
Despite its growing popularity, blogging continues to evolve, transforming into something more than just a hobby or a means of self-expression. It has become a valuable tool for sharing information and creating opportunities for individuals to showcase their talents. As the medium continues to mature, it is likely that we will see even more innovative applications of blogging in the years to come.

input: HOUSTON (CN)  A Mexican woman being held in a Houston immigration jail despite agreeing to return to the country she left with her parents as an infant won a small victory Monday when a federal judge said she should get a bond hearing to lobby for
continuation:
her release.

I dont understand what she is in jail for, said Sara Rios, the only sister in her brothers legal file. Why would she need to go back?

U.S. Magistrate Judge Sarah Lynn Ritchie ruled in her favor, stating in a brief order that she should not be kept in the facility while she awaits her immigration court date. The detention could also hurt her case, she said.

It is possible, especially in this case, that Ms. Rios presence may unnecessarily complicate or delay her release pending her hearing, Ritchie wrote. In this case, Ms. Rios immigration case is still unresolved. Until it is resolved, she should not remain in this detention facility, she continued.

U.S. Attorney Henry McCarrick of Houston said he was pleased with the decision.

Im really disappointed in the decision of the court, McCarrick said in an interview with The Houston Chronicle. I think it was really a wrong decision made.

McCarrick said he
paraphrase:
A Houston woman, who was born in Mexico and is currently being held in an immigration jail in the city, has won a small victory after a federal judge ruled that she should have a bond hearing to argue for her release. Sara Rios, the woman's only sister, expressed confusion over the reason for her detention, asking why she would need to return to her home country.
U.S. Magistrate Judge Sarah Lynn Ritchie ruled in favor of Rios, stating that she should not be held in the detention facility while she awaits her immigration court date. Ritchie noted that Rios' detention could potentially complicate or delay her release, and that it is important to resolve her immigration case as soon as possible.
U.S. Attorney Henry McCarrick expressed disappointment in the decision, arguing that it was a mistake. Despite this, McCarrick acknowledged that Rios' immigration case is still unresolved and that she should not remain in detention indefinitely.
Rios' case highlights the complex and often challenging process of immigration law, which can result in individuals being detained for extended periods of time while their cases are pending. The issue is a contentious one, with many advocates arguing that detention is often used unfairly and that alternatives, such as the use of electronic monitoring or other forms of supervision, would be more effective and humane.

input: The five-member team of Indian MPs, which interacted with a cross section of political leaders, civil society personalities and government functionaries both in Colombo and Jaffna over the last four days, returned to India on Friday, fully sensitised to
continuation: the concerns of the people of Tamil Nadu, where the next general election will be held next year. This is hardly surprising. For one, Tamil Nadu accounts for over a fifth of Indias population, nearly one-third of its states economy, nearly one-third of its foreign trade, one-third of its foreign direct investment, and over one-fourth of its exports. Tamil Nadus politics also involves the interests of the Tamil diaspora, which accounts for almost 20 per cent of Indias foreign trade, more than 20 per cent of its foreign investment and more than one-third of its export earnings. As I wrote in my first piece, which was based on a discussion with Tamil diaspora members in Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Kochi, Tirupati, Madurai, Madurai, Kancheepuram, Kollam, Palakkad, Tiruvallur, Trichy, Kanyakumari, Kannur, Salem, Virudhunagar, Tiruvarur, Karur, Thanjavur, Thiruvananthapuram, Coimbatore, Tiruvannamalai, Trichy
paraphrase: The Indian MPs' team, which met with various political leaders, civil society members, and government officials in Colombo and Jaffna over the past four days, returned to India on Friday with a deep understanding of the concerns of the people of Tamil Nadu. This is unsurprising, given that Tamil Nadu accounts for nearly one-third of Indias population, economy, foreign trade, foreign investment, and exports. The politics of Tamil Nadu also intersects with the interests of the Tamil diaspora, who contribute significantly to Indias foreign trade, foreign investment, and export earnings. As I previously discussed with members of the Tamil diaspora in Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, and other cities, the next general election in Tamil Nadu will be a crucial event with significant implications for the country as a whole.

input:
All eyes will be on Telkom and its subsidiary Vodacom tomorrow as they release their annual financial results.
However, the intense interest will not be about the companies impressive numbers. Investors are expected to demand explanations of, among
continuation:
other things, whether it is possible to deliver what was promised to consumers in the face of growing competition from Free State-owned operator, Freecell.
On the one hand, there are concerns of the viability of this relationship, which is under-performing. On the other hand, there are concerns that it will lead to disruption in the sector in general.
While many of these concerns are legitimate, others are just plain wrong.
I will go into this in greater detail, beginning with concerns about Freecell. To date, Freecells annualised revenue is R35.6 billion, of which R32.6 billion is from fixed-line service. Of its subscribers, 1.1 million are on mobile. The companys latest annual report says its fixed-line revenue rose from R26.6 billion in the year to end-August 2018 to R28.1 billion in the year to end-August 2019, despite more competition. This was despite an ongoing increase in fixed-line competition. At the same time, revenue per customer is expected to have declined, even if the fixed-line service is expanding.
Freecells fixed-line revenue is expected to increase in the
paraphrase:
Tomorrow, Telkom and its subsidiary Vodacom will release their annual financial results, with the spotlight on them as they address concerns from investors. While the companies' impressive numbers are anticipated, the real focus will be on how they plan to address growing competition from Free State-owned operator Freecell.
Some concerns surrounding this relationship include its underperformance and the potential for disruption in the industry as a whole. However, not all of these concerns are valid, and Freecell's latest annual report shows that its fixed-line revenue has increased from R26.6 billion in the year to end-August 2018 to R28.1 billion in the year to end-August 2019, despite a growing number of competitors. While the revenue per customer is expected to have declined, Freecell's fixed-line service is expanding, with 1.1 million subscribers on mobile.
In their response, Telkom and Vodacom will likely provide more detail on how they plan to address these concerns and maintain their position in the industry.

input:

Executive Vice President John Squ

ier, in his new role, will oversee the company's new corporate strategy, strategy, business, communications, human resources and other internal affairs groups. He will report directly to Time Inc. Chairman, President and CEO Gary Newman.

Time Inc.'s content divisions are currently led by Senior Vice President of Publisher Relations Beth A. Rolin. I am thrilled to now step in as executive editor, working with Gary Newman to help build the next-generation of brands, new content ideas, new experiences for our consumers and new ideas for our company," said Squier.
"I've worked with Beth for
paraphrase:
Time Inc. is poised to take center stage in its digital future, with the company positioning itself to compete directly with networks by creating captivating, original content that originates from the distinct voices of its renowned publishing brands. Currently, Time Inc.'s content divisions are led by Senior Vice President of Publisher Relations Beth A. Rolin, who will continue to help its brands "communicate the latest developments in news, lifestyle, technology, sports, entertainment, fashion, politics, business, technology, beauty, home, and garden through unique, insightful storytelling from the experts shaping these industries," according to a company statement.

input: After a botched start that included a round of Fix You, Coldplays Chris Martin led his band into their first-ever live performance of Atlas last night in London. The song is Coldplay
continuation:
first No. 1, debuting No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100, with a massive second week. Its also the bands first No. 1 single, surpassing 2008s Run To You. Its also the bands fifth No. 1 album, tying them with The Beatles, who also earned their fifth No. 1 album, with Abbey Road in 1972.

Coldplay kicked things off with, um, some backing from the crowd, before they got to the songs themselves. Fix You was written in 2008 and was Coldplays first single. After it failed to chart, Martin recorded Atlas with Paul McCartney and James Murphy in 2010, adding drums, bass, backing vocals and more. It spent two weeks on the chart, peaking No. 3, while in its second week it reached No. 1, staying in that place for its entire second week. The band re-released the single in 2011, with remixes from The Prodigys Keith Flint and Flosstradamuss James Murphy. The remix album was released later that year, with
paraphrase: Coldplay made their live debut of "Atlas" last night in London, following a rocky start that included a rendition of "Fix You." Lead singer Chris Martin led the band through a energetic performance, which included crowd participation and a unique blend of old and new sounds. "Fix You," which was released in 2008, was Coldplay's first single, but it failed to chart. Undeterred, Martin teamed up with Paul McCartney and James Murphy in 2010 to record "Atlas," which spent two weeks on the charts before peaking at No. 3. After a successful re-release in 2011 with remixes from The Prodigy's Keith Flint and Flosstradamus' James Murphy, "Atlas" reached new heights, debuting at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100. With this achievement, Coldplay tied with The Beatles for the most No. 1 albums, with a total of five. The band's success is a testament to their ability to evolve and experiment with their sound, while still maintaining their signature style.

input:
ATTOCK  The Attock Chamber of Commerce and Industry (ACCI) on Sunday said extensive sensitive lists being maintained by different countries is hindering progress and growth of trade within Saarc region.
The last two decades have witnessed a number of attempts
continuation:
to impose trade sanctions on Saarc countries, but these have failed due to robust commitment of member countries of SAARC to strengthen regional trade, ACCI Chairman Shabana Azmi said.
Sanctions are hindering progress of trade in SAARC, which should be facilitated, she said while talking to APP.
Shabana Azmi said, the members should move in the direction of modernization of regional trade.
Sensitive lists should be developed under SAARC Trade, Industry, Investment, and Technology Cooperation. It should include agriculture, tourism, fisheries, medical equipment, pharmaceutical, medical equipment, pharmaceutical raw material, medical equipment components, IT equipment, and IT professionals, she said.
On the occasion, ACCI Vice Chairman Shoaib Iqbal said trade deficit in SAARC is increasing while trade deficit with other countries is decreasing.
In 2016-2017, trade deficit of SAARC was Rs1,330.71 billion while trade deficit with other countries was only Rs1,081.84 billion, he said.
Shoaib Iqbal said in 2016-2017, trade deficit with India stood at Rs26.06
paraphrase:
The Attock Chamber of Commerce and Industry (ACCI) believes that the maintenance of extensive and sensitive lists by various countries is hindering the progress and growth of trade within the Saarc region. Despite attempts to impose trade sanctions on Saarc countries over the past two decades, these efforts have been unsuccessful due to the strong commitment of member countries to enhance regional trade.
ACCI Chairperson Shabana Azmi emphasizes the need for the members to move towards modernizing regional trade. She suggests developing sensitive lists under the SAARC Trade, Industry, Investment, and Technology Cooperation framework, which would include agriculture, tourism, fisheries, medical equipment, pharmaceuticals, medical equipment components, IT equipment, and IT professionals.
During the occasion, ACCI Vice Chairman Shoaib Iqbal highlights the increasing trade deficit in SAARC, which stood at Rs1,330.71 billion in 2016-2017, while the trade deficit with other countries decreased to Rs1,081.84 billion. Furthermore, he notes that the trade deficit with India stood at Rs26.06 billion in the same period.

input:
The West might have been won with the Winchester. But Japan was ruled with the katana. It's not simply what the gun is to Americans, the sword is to the Japanese. It's much more, and then some.
As master sword
continuation: master Shintoku-Dai, I feel that I must inform you that I use other weapons, too.  If I get to choose what I want to use in my next life, I will most certainly go with guns.  The one I currently wield is from Japan, of course.
paraphrase:
The East was conquered with the katana, yet the West was won with the trusty Winchester. However, Japan's history was shaped by the sword, not just a tool for fighting. It's more than just a weapon, it's a symbol of cultural identity and heritage.
As a skilled master swordsman, I must admit that my arsenal extends beyond the katana. In my next life, I would opt for something more modern, like a firearm. My current weapon, you see, is a prized Japanese sword, imbued with history and tradition.

input:
eBay is ending its payment processing relationship with PayPal, but let's dive deeper.
eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) unveiled a nice little surprise for investors with its fourth-quarter earnings report. Well, nice for eBay; not
continuation:
so much for PayPal. After all, PayPal doesn't generate cash, PayPal doesn't own eBay, PayPal didn't acquire eBay. It doesn't really matter. The truth is, PayPal is in the wrong here. This is just one more nail in the coffin of what used to be one of the most important e-commerce platforms in the world.
Continue Reading Below
PayPal made money on its e-commerce business. eBay, as many investors may recall, made money in its legacy e-commerce business. Now, it appears, PayPal is making more money in its new e-commerce business. That will put more pressure on eBay. More pressure, in other words, for PayPal.
Let's first set the stage. Back in the days when PayPal was only selling goods, when it was merely eBay in disguise, it made money from its business. The problem was, eBay didn't profit from its business. It just sold goods. PayPal did.
Image source: PayPal.
Here's how it worked. If eBay sold goods, PayPal would buy goods from sellers. For eBay, this was just a nice little extra. It wasn't much of a problem. PayPal made money from its business. eBay didn't
paraphrase:
eBay's decision to end its payment processing relationship with PayPal may seem like a surprise to some, but it actually marks a significant shift in the company's business strategy.
In its fourth-quarter earnings report, eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) revealed a novel approach to generating revenue, one that could potentially benefit the company in the long run. By focusing on its legacy e-commerce business, eBay was able to generate profits, a feat that PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) could not replicate.
The dynamics between eBay and PayPal were complex, with PayPal making money from its e-commerce business while eBay relied on its legacy business. However, with PayPal's growing success in its new e-commerce ventures, the pressure on eBay to keep up has increased.
To understand the situation, it's important to delve into the past. Back when PayPal was primarily a platform for selling goods, it made money from its transactions. However, eBay itself did not profit from its business, as it was primarily focused on selling goods. This created a symbiotic relationship between the two companies, with PayPal making money from its transactions, while eBay benefited from the additional revenue.
Now, with eBay's decision to end its payment processing relationship with PayPal, the dynamic has shifted. While PayPal continues to generate revenue from its e-commerce business, eBay is focusing on its legacy business and exploring new opportunities. This shift could lead to more competition between the two companies, but it also presents an opportunity for eBay to redefine its business strategy and capitalize on new revenue streams.

input:
WASHINGTON (CNNMoney)  The White House initial proposal to avert the fiscal cliff includes $200 billion in economic boosters  a stimulus plan Republican critics are railing against when they say the country needs to start reducing debt.
But even deficit hawks say
continuation:
it doesnt go far enough. House Budget Committee Chair Paul Ryan (R-Wis.) says its still more than enough.
I think it is significant, said Ryan, a member of the presidents deficit commission. He added, weve got a much bigger task here.
I think it is modest, said Sen. Chuck Grassley (R-Iowa), chairman of the Senate Finance Committee.
The White House released its preliminary proposal, dubbed the American Jobs Plan, on Tuesday, just days before a major vote in Congress to raise taxes. The proposal was expected to increase deficit spending.
It envisions boosting military spending, overhauling the education system, making job training easier and offering help with new energy sources. Its set to begin in January, but it will need Congress to sign off.
If Congress really cares about job creation, it should pass this bill, said Budget Committee Chairman Paul Ryan (R-Wis.)
A White House press release said the jobs plan, if passed, could create 100 million new jobs by 2030. But it also said it would raise deficit spending,
paraphrase:
The White House has unveiled a proposal aimed at mitigating the impending fiscal cliff, dubbed the "American Jobs Plan." The plan includes a stimulus package valued at $200 billion, which has sparked criticism from some Republicans who believe the country needs to reduce its debt. However, even deficit hawks acknowledge that the proposal does not go far enough.
House Budget Committee Chairman Paul Ryan (R-Wis.) believes the plan is still too expensive, stating, "We've got a much bigger task here." Senate Finance Committee Chairman Chuck Grassley (R-Iowa) shares a similar sentiment, describing the proposal as "modest."
The plan envisions increased military spending, overhauls to the education system, easier job training, and support for new energy sources. It is slated to begin in January, but will require congressional approval.
According to a White House press release, the jobs plan could create up to 100 million new jobs by 2030, but it also acknowledges that it would increase deficit spending.
Budget Committee Chairman Ryan urged Congress to pass the bill, stating, "If Congress really cares about job creation, it should pass this bill."

input:
A Hong Kong real estate billionaire has doubled the reward amount to any man who is willing to win over his lesbian daughters heart.
In 2012, Cecil Chao initially set the amount for $65 million after receiving news that his daughter, 33
continuation:
-year-old Christina, was dating French singer Alain Delon, in the midst of her divorce from her husband, the actor, billionaire Tony Kwan. That same year, she reportedly moved in with him.
On Wednesday, she upped her reward to $150 million, according to the Chinese tabloid Global Times, which was first to report the news. The reason: Christina was reportedly dumped this week by Delon, whose career she helped him launch. Christinas lesbian relationship is also said to be under scrutiny.
Get push notifications with news, features and more.
It is said her love of Alain is hurting her father, a source told the tabloid, adding, It seems she is running from her responsibilities. A rep for Christina did not immediately return PEOPLEs request for comment.
Cecil is Hong Kongs third-richest business man, with holdings in telecommunications, luxury fashion and property. Hes also co-founder of Kwans TCL Group, which is listed in Shanghais stock market.
Alain Delon, pictured here in Beijing in 2016. Richy Shepherd/Invision/
paraphrase:
A wealthy Hong Kong businessman has increased the reward for anyone who can win over his daughter's heart, previously set at $65 million, to an impressive $150 million. The businessman, Cecil Chao, is reportedly eager to see his 33-year-old daughter, Christina, settled down with a man, as she was recently dumped by her French singer boyfriend, Alain Delon, whose career she had helped launch. According to sources, Christina's lesbian relationship is also under scrutiny. While Chao's desire to see his daughter happy is understandable, the attention placed on her personal life may be seen as an invasion of her privacy. A representative for Christina did not immediately respond to requests for comment.
Chao, Hong Kong's third-richest businessman, has a vast portfolio of holdings in telecommunications, luxury fashion, and property, and is also a co-founder of Kwans TCL Group, listed on Shanghais stock market. Meanwhile, Delon, a former model and actor, has been making headlines in recent years for his various business ventures and high-profile relationships.

input:
MORRISTOWN  The Stuart Country Day School girls basketball team won its second straight NJISAA Prep B Tournament Wednesday by defeating top-seeded Morristown-Beard on the road, 71-63.
Senior forward Bey
continuation:
ona Koyenga, a 6-foot-1 freshman, led the Stags with 20 points. Koyenga also registered six rebounds. Sophomore guard Tayler Lassiter added 11 points, while freshman guard Madison Lassiter finished with 10 points, six rebounds, and six assists.
Senior guard Aaliyah Williams paced Morristown-Beard with 20 points, while sophomore guard Jadice Johnson had 20 points and freshman guard Kyra Williams finished with 12 points. Senior guard Olivia Miller led the Wildcats with 10 rebounds, while sophomore guard Lauren Rains added nine rebounds.
I think this is what we've been working toward, Stuart Country Day head coach Justin Lassiter said of his girls record in this years tournament.
In other action:
Old Bridge 64, Colts Neck 45: The Colts Neck girls basketball team suffered its second consecutive defeat in the NJISAA Prep A Tournament. The Colts Neck, which advanced to the championship game in 2016, fell to Old Bridge in this years tournament.
Senior guard Mackenzie Bell led Colts Neck with 24 points. Senior guard Madalyn Rizzo, junior guard Marcy R
paraphrase:
The Stuart Country Day School girls basketball team emerged victorious in their second consecutive NJISAA Prep B Tournament, defeating top-seeded Morristown-Beard on the road with a score of 71-63.
Led by senior forward Beyona Koyenga, who contributed 20 points and six rebounds, the Stags showed remarkable teamwork and determination. Sophomore guard Tayler Lassiter added 11 points, while freshman guard Madison Lassiter chipped in with 10 points, six rebounds, and six assists.
In a fierce battle, senior guard Aaliyah Williams led Morristown-Beard with 20 points, while sophomore guard Jadice Johnson and freshman guard Kyra Williams each scored 20 points. Senior guard Olivia Miller paced the Wildcats with 10 rebounds, while sophomore guard Lauren Rains contributed nine rebounds.
"This is a testament to the hard work and dedication of my team," said Stuart Country Day head coach Justin Lassiter. "They've been working towards this goal all season, and it's great to see their efforts pay off."
In other matchups, Old Bridge triumphed over Colts Neck with a score of 64-45, bringing an end to the Colts Neck girls basketball team's two-game winning streak in the NJISAA Prep A Tournament.
Senior guard Mackenzie Bell led the Colts Neck with 24 points, while senior guard Madalyn Rizzo and junior guard Marcy R added 12 points each. Despite their valiant efforts, the Colts Neck were unable to overcome Old Bridge's strong performance.

input:
Ontarios doctors are talking about a job action in the new year, escalating their argument with the province over how and how much they should be paid.
So far its just a threat  the threat of a threat,
continuation:
said Peter Juniper, president of the Ontario Medical Association, but he was concerned.
I think its certainly something I dont think (Premier Doug) Ford or his government takes too lightly, he said.
Juniper said hes heard from doctors across the province  from small practices in rural communities to major hospitals in Toronto  about the issues theyve seen with rising costs, low wages and the inability of staff to get enough coverage under the new provincial health-care system. Its getting worse, he said.
Its just been escalating with costs going up, Juniper said.
Its just been going on.
Ontarios premier said he thinks its an unfair fight. But his government is willing to listen.
Were willing to talk, Ford said in an interview with CBC Radios Metro Morning. But I also think doctors should just go back to work.
Juniper said hes heard doctors are making more in Vancouver than in Toronto, and its time
paraphrase: Doctors in Ontario are contemplating a job action in the new year, escalating their dispute with the provincial government over pay and working conditions. Peter Juniper, president of the Ontario Medical Association, expressed concern about the situation, stating that while it's just a threat so far, he believes Premier Doug Ford's government takes it seriously. Juniper mentioned that he has received input from doctors across the province, including those in rural communities and major hospitals in Toronto, regarding the issues they face with rising costs, low wages, and the inability of staff to get adequate coverage under the new healthcare system. He emphasized that the situation is worsening and escalating, with costs continuing to rise. Juniper stated that doctors are making more in some areas, such as Vancouver, than in Toronto, and it's time for change.

input: Interior designer Abbe Fenimore knew that adding a kitchen island was one of the most important decisions shed make in remodeling her 1940s-era home in Dallas. A well-designed kitchen island can offer storage space, a work
continuation:
area, and an option to cook. Heres what she did in her updated kitchen.

Fenimore began by sketching out her ideas of what she wanted from her kitchen. She drew inspiration from her favorite interior designers. Then she asked her husband, Ron, what his preference was. Rons preference is much more modern, but he was willing to listen, too. He made small changes in the kitchen, like replacing outdated cabinets with new-style modern ones, while Abbe filled in with more modern kitchen-related details. The two of them then looked at a variety of kitchen-related ideas, before narrowing it down to one or two. Abbe said she ended up using six or seven ideas. The final kitchen was built into her office.

1. Add a kitchen island.

I loved it, Abbe said. Ron said he wasnt quite sure why. He said it was his favorite part of the kitchen. Abbe said her children are grown, so she doesnt use it anymore, which was his next choice. But he was willing to listen, too, and even helped Abbe with some of her ideas. He even helped
paraphrase:
Interior designer Abbe Fenimore recognized the significance of incorporating a kitchen island during her home remodeling project in Dallas. She believed that a well-designed island could provide ample storage space, a functional work area, and even an option to cook. To begin, Fenimore sketched out her ideas and drew inspiration from her favorite interior designers. She then consulted with her husband, Ron, who had a more modern aesthetic, but was willing to consider Fenimore's suggestions. Together, they explored various kitchen-related ideas and ultimately narrowed them down to one or two. The final design was integrated into Fenimore's home office.
Fenimore expressed her delight with the outcome, while Ron seemed less certain. Despite his reservations, he was willing to listen to and assist Fenimore with her ideas. As they worked together, Ron even helped Fenime with some of her design choices. Through their collaborative effort, the final kitchen design was created.

input:
And both those games could spell the difference between the Dolphins making the playoffs or missing the postseason for the second time in Gases three seasons as coach.
But heres the thing: Both those games have a common theme in
continuation:
them. Both of them ended in a 20-0 win.
Its just that one game is in December. Its also the one game thatll determine whether or not the Dolphins go to Denver or Kansas City. If Denver or KC win, it could help Miami get into the AFCs top eight. But if either one of them win, it could propel them into the top six.
Either way, itll end up in another tie. And it will end up in Miamis second-ever, one-game playoff, which it is currently 1-0 in. The Dolphins are one of seven teams with a losing record in one-game playoffs. The other six are AFC South rivals: Jacksonville, Tennessee, Houston, Indianapolis, Pittsburgh and Tennessee.
If Miami were to win this game, itll put it in the AFCs No. 6 spot, where it currently sits. If Denver, with seven more wins, wins, itll move into No. 6, with six more victories, putting it in the No. 3 spot. If Kansas City wins, it will stay in No. 7, where it currently sits.
paraphrase: The upcoming games for the Miami Dolphins could have a significant impact on their chances of making the playoffs. A win in either of the two games could determine whether they secure a top-eight spot or miss the postseason for the second time in three seasons under coach Gase. The common theme between the two games is that they both ended in a 20-0 victory, but one of them will decide Miami's fate in the AFC standings. A win could move the Dolphins into the No. 6 spot, while a loss could result in them staying in the current No. 7 position. The other six teams in the AFC with a losing record in one-game playoffs, including Jacksonville, Tennessee, Houston, Indianapolis, Pittsburgh, and Tennessee, will also be watching the outcome of these games closely.

input: Ethiopia says despite its trade relations with Somalias breakaway enclave of Somaliland, it does not support the sovereignty of the self-declared republic. Ethiopian foreign minister Seyoum Mesfin says Somaliland deserves to be
continuation: included in the UN. He says in Addis Ababa, Somaliland is a small place with few resources. It should be considered in the same way as Somaliland in Africa. Somaliland is one of the six states in the internationally recognized Federal Republic of Somalia. But Somaliland is recognised separately from its counterpart in neighboring Somaliland, where its sovereignty is contested. On its part, Somaliland says its secession will only happen with international support.
paraphrase: Ethiopia has emphasized that its trade ties with the breakaway region of Somaliland do not imply endorsement of its sovereignty. According to Ethiopian Foreign Minister Seyoum Mesfin, Somaliland should be considered for membership in the United Nations due to its unique situation. While acknowledging Somaliland's limited resources, Mesfin argued that it should be treated similarly to Somalia in Africa. Somaliland is one of six states within the internationally recognized Federal Republic of Somalia, but its sovereignty is contested by neighboring Somaliland. In contrast, Somaliland's leaders maintain that secession can only occur with international backing.

JACKSONVILLE, Fla. - Police have released a picture of the car they are searching for in connection with a robbery and shooting at the BP gas station in Arlington on Wednesday.
Detectives said the armed man shot the owner of the business
continuation:
in the leg. The man was not injured in the incident. Police said he ran away. The owners of the gas station said he was armed. Police said the man was wearing a red bandana.
"I want it back. I want it back. I've worked hard in this gas station. I've been here six or seven years. I was here when this place was built. I've done everything. I've worked this gas station, said Greg Perry, gas station owner.
In addition to his pain, Perry said hes also scared.
I dont think Ill live with it, Perry said.
An hour later, police said the same car was involved in a shooting off of I-95. Police said its possible the same man may have been involved in the gas station robbery.
"I'm still confused. I just dont know why theyd go around like this, said customer Jeff Smith.
In response to the shooting, police are reminding people that if you feel uncomfortable, stay home.
"You dont want this. This is bad. We just want it
paraphrase:
JACKSONVILLE, Florida - Police have released a photo of the vehicle they are investigating in connection with a robbery and shooting at a BP gas station in Arlington on Wednesday.
Officers said an armed man shot the business owner in the leg, but he was not injured in the incident. The suspect fled the scene. The gas station owner, Greg Perry, expressed his frustration and fear, stating that he has worked hard to build his business and cannot bear the thought of someone causing harm to it.
"I want it back. I want it back. I've worked hard in this gas station. I've been here six or seven years. I was here when this place was built. I've done everything. I've worked this gas station," Perry said.
Perry also expressed his fear and concern for his safety and the safety of his business, stating that he does not think he will be able to live with the knowledge of the incident.
Later that day, police reported that the same vehicle was involved in a shooting off of I-95, leading them to believe that the same individual may have been responsible for the gas station robbery.
"I'm still confused. I just dont know why they'd go around like this," customer Jeff Smith said in response to the shooting.
In light of the incident, police are urging people to remain vigilant and to stay home if they feel uncomfortable.
"You dont want this. This is bad. We just want it to stop," a police spokesperson said.

input:
Attractive display of merchandise, like these antique bottles, attracts customers to your booth.
Every clothing store owner wants to see heavy traffic on the sales floor, but sales associates often need motivation to persuade the shopper to turn "I'm just looking
continuation:
" into "I just bought." The same is true for florists, which need colorfully colored flower arrangements to entice more colorfully colored flower buyers. Here are five ways florists can create "happy accidents" when designing displays.
1. Put items in order of preference. Flowers that are in similar arrangements look "attractive" more often. If you are unsure of the order in which flower selections should be placed, choose one arrangement with similar colors, or choose one arrangement based on its color. "Think colors rather than items, or if it is a choice, order according to the color rather than style," says Beth Chavira, owner of Sweetie's Flowers in Ann Arbor, Mich.
2. Let color determine color choices. Chavira recommends thinking of the arrangement as something of interest rather than just decoration. "A little color is always welcome, especially if it is in place of, or complements, what is in front of it," says Chavira. "Just like in color, it is okay to mix patterns, especially in florals, or, if there is too much of one, use the colors of the opposite color, which is also okay." "It is important
paraphrase:
A visually appealing display of merchandise, such as these vintage bottles, can lure customers to a vendor's booth. Every retailer aims to see a bustling sales floor, but sales associates often require encouragement to convert "window shoppers" into paying customers. The same is true for florists, who require colorful flower arrangements to attract more colorful flower buyers. Here are five strategies florists can employ to create unplanned happy moments when designing displays.
1. Group items according to preference. Flowers with similar arrangements tend to appear more attractive more frequently. If uncertain about the order in which flower selections should be placed, choose one arrangement with similar colors or select one arrangement based on its color. As Beth Chavira, owner of Sweetie's Flowers in Ann Arbor, Michigan, advises, "Think colors rather than items, or, if necessary, arrange according to color rather than style."
2. Let color guide color choices. Chavira recommends viewing the arrangement as a point of interest rather than just decoration. "A little color is always welcome, especially if it complements or contrasts with what is in front of it," she says. "Just like in color, it's okay to mix patterns, especially in floral arrangements, or, if there's too much of one, use the colors of the opposite hue, which is also acceptable."
3. Use a variety of textures and materials to add depth and visual interest to the display. This can include incorporating different types of flowers, foliage, and other decorative elements.
4. Experiment with different vase sizes and shapes to create a visually appealing display. Avoid using vases that are too large or too small for the arrangement, as this can make the display appear cluttered or unbalanced.
5. Consider incorporating seasonal elements, such as fruits or branches, into the display to add an extra touch of visual interest. These elements can help create a cohesive and seasonally appropriate look that will attract customers to the display.

input:
Friday, the Fourth National Climate Assessment was released. Its a sobering look at the economic and physical effects of climate change in the United States, and where those changes are leading.
At 1,656 pages, the report is massive
continuation:
. But it also offers new estimates of heat-related death rates, flooding, wildfires, and other disasters. It also highlights growing costs in terms of natural resources, human health, and government response. (Some of this is expected, of course. But much of it is new. The report also highlights what appears to be shifting, if not quite yet reversing, patterns of environmental degradation.)
Lets look at whats new. It paints an especially grim picture of what it means to live in states like Arizona, which are already feeling the effects of climate change in ways big and small.
In the first seven decades of this century, Arizonas economy will suffer an average 7 percent increase in heat-related casualties. The average annual death toll could rise, even in low- and moderate-income counties. By 2080, Arizona could experience more heat-related fatalities than any other state.
In terms of natural resources, this report found that:
In the past decade, natural resource values, such as aquatic habitat, soil and plant, grassland, wetlands, and more, have declined in many areas.
Heat-related illness will increase more in poorer counties. But heat-
paraphrase:
The Fourth National Climate Assessment, released on Friday, provides a comprehensive analysis of the economic and environmental impacts of climate change in the United States. At a massive 1,656 pages, the report offers new estimates of heat-related deaths, flooding, wildfires, and other disasters, as well as growing costs in terms of natural resources, human health, and government responses.
While some aspects of the report are expected, there are also several new findings that paint a concerning picture of the effects of climate change. For example, Arizona is particularly vulnerable to heat-related illnesses, with an average 7% increase in heat-related casualties projected for the states economy in the first seven decades of this century. Even in low- and moderate-income counties, the average annual death toll could rise. By 2080, Arizona could experience more heat-related fatalities than any other state.
The report also highlights the decline of natural resources, including aquatic habitat, soil, grassland, wetlands, and more, in many areas over the past decade. Heat-related illness will disproportionately affect poorer counties, but the impact will be felt across all areas.
In summary, the Fourth National Climate Assessment offers a sobering look at the economic and environmental consequences of climate change in the United States, with a particular focus on the devastating effects on states like Arizona. The report highlights both expected and new findings, underscoring the urgent need for action to mitigate the impacts of climate change.

input:
Mr Clegg had done a Greta Garbo... I vant to be alone!
Anyone seen our Cleggy? Lib Dem MPs sat there looking faintly sorrowful, like children who had just booted their football over the garden fence. This was
continuation:
not one of them. No, this was the kind of leader that makes even his supporters weep with grief. He was in his bath, gazing sadly out of his window. I swear to god, he was. It was like Id heard one of his speeches. What shall we do, Cleggy, with this crisis, hed say. I didnt believe it. Im the first to admit that Im a sceptical type of politician. Im always suspicious, I look too far in advance, Im too concerned with the details. But I could feel this one in me, this gnawing, growing sense of desperation, of fear. Id been in politics just shy of ten years. The time was getting late. It was time to get off. It was time to get out. I remember him looking me squarely in the eye, as if Id really said it. I was almost in tears. I tried to wipe them away with a finger, but it just made it worse. It was time to go.
I think if Im going to be honest with myself, I
paraphrase:
Mr Clegg had been feeling rather like a Greta Garbo of late, craving solitude and contemplation. Lib Dem MPs looked on with a mix of sadness and concern, like children whose beloved football had flown over the fence. This particular leader inspired even his closest supporters to feel a sense of deep sorrow, as if he were a vessel for their collective worries and fears.
As he bathed and gazed out the window, Clegg couldn't shake off the feeling of impending doom. It was as if he could hear the echoes of his own speeches in his mind, urging his followers to take action, to confront the crisis head-on. But Clegg was a skeptical soul, always questioning the motives of others and minutely analyzing every detail. And so, despite his ten years in politics, he couldn't shake off the feeling that it was time to move on, to leave the fray and find solace in the quiet.
With a direct stare, Clegg had previously addressed his doubts and fears with a trusted ally, as if to confirm that the time had come to bid farewell. Tears threatened to spill, but Clegg's finger swiped them away before they could fall. It was time to go, time to retreat and recharge, leaving the burdens of politics behind for a while.

input: Infertility is one of the most difficult problems a couple can go through, and many people find discussing the issue with friends and family only makes things worse. A new study found that there are differences in the way men and women share information about their fertility
continuation: issues. A previous study indicated that when it came to male issues, many people were willing to go with what they could remember or rely on friends. Women, on the other hand, may share things more openly or use less information. The researchers surveyed 1,004 women who are in or nearing retirement age. A majority said they've never considered or tried in-vitro fertilization (IVF), either due to concerns or just not knowing anything about it. Only 46 percent of women said they've considered assisted reproduction, like adoption or in-vitro fertilization. A majority (68 percent) said they've tried something, like using condoms or birth control, but only 41 percent said they've been successful. Women also said they've never considered using in-vitro fertilization to treat their infertility or with children. A majority (63 percent) said it was either too expensive or too risky.
paraphrase: The issue of infertility can be a sensitive and challenging experience for couples, and sharing it with friends and family may not always be helpful. A recent study found that there are differences in the way men and women disclose information about their fertility problems. The study discovered that men are more likely to rely on their memories or seek advice from friends, while women tend to be more open about their struggles. The researchers surveyed 1,004 women aged 50 and above and found that the majority had never considered or tried in-vitro fertilization (IVF), with concerns about cost and safety being the primary reasons. Only 46% of the women surveyed had considered assisted reproduction methods such as adoption or IVF. The study also revealed that the majority of women (68%) had tried various methods to conceive, such as using condoms or birth control, but only 41% were successful. Additionally, the majority of women (63%) felt that IVF was either too expensive or too risky.

input:
Ford is accelerating the automotive design process with the Microsoft HoloLens virtual reality headset after a year-long pilot program.
Coming off a year-long pilot program, Microsoft and Ford have taken the wraps off a collaboration between the two companies that will help
continuation:
with the design of future vehicles. The collaboration will utilize the HoloLens technology to help with automotive interior design, creating what Ford calls 'a new generation of technology.'
Ford is testing the technology with 20 employees. The goal of this pilot program is 'the first of its kind to support a collaboration with a major automobile manufacturer.' As part of the pilot program, 20 participants are using HoloLens VR headsets to work with Ford. The 20 participants are working in Ford Design studios around the world. All of them have Ford vehicles, while all of them also use HoloLens. The participants also help with interior design ideas. After this pilot program is done, Ford says it will 'use this collaboration with HoloLens in its automotive studios around the world.' The company will also share its use of HoloLens with other major automotive companies, including Tesla, Volkswagen, and Nissan.
Microsoft is one of the only major tech companies working with automakers. Google and Samsung also develop VR technologies, but these are more focused on mobile or enterprise applications. Googles Glass is more of an enterprise or augmented reality product. Samsung also just launched its Galaxy Z Flip smartphone, which also features 360-degree cameras. Samsung also offers its own augmented reality glasses called Spect
paraphrase:
Ford is revolutionizing the automotive design process by partnering with Microsoft on a year-long pilot program. The collaboration utilizes cutting-edge HoloLens virtual reality technology to streamline interior design for future vehicles. With 20 employees participating in the program, Ford aims to leverage this innovative solution to create a new generation of technology-infused vehicles.
The pilot program marks a significant milestone in the automotive industry, as Ford becomes one of the first major manufacturers to adopt VR technology in their design studios worldwide. By integrating HoloLens into their workflow, Ford employees can now work on interior design ideas in a more immersive and efficient manner.
Furthermore, Ford plans to share its experience with other major automotive companies, including Tesla, Volkswagen, and Nissan. This strategic partnership between Ford and Microsoft signifies a major shift in the industry, as tech companies increasingly play a role in shaping the future of transportation.
While other tech giants like Google and Samsung are also investing in VR technology, their focus is mainly on mobile or enterprise applications. In contrast, Microsoft's HoloLens is specifically designed for automotive use cases, offering a more seamless and practical solution for designers.
In summary, Ford's partnership with Microsoft on HoloLens represents a significant step forward in the automotive industry's adoption of VR technology, setting the stage for a new era of innovation and collaboration.

input:
This is our last day of discussing Betty Friedan's The Feminine Mystique. Join us at 3pm for a live chat and then follow along on Twitter using the hashtag #newmystique.
 Friedan is very interested in female
continuation:
psychology, psychology in general, and Freudian psychology. In general, she is concerned with power (and its misuse) in society.
 Friedan is also concerned with gender, especially within her analysis of the "feminine mystique." "Feminine mystique" is the name given to any theory or philosophy that suggests women are in need of more power in order to feel fully human.
 Friedan is concerned with women's powerlessness, or in other words, with women in general, rather than with any individual woman. This means she is concerned with women's sense of powerlessness within relationships, whether with men or with other women. This is, in effect, the same understanding that Friedan, like Freud, puts on love, with women, rather than love itself. This is not quite the same, obviously, in terms of her emphasis on women, rather than love, and her emphasis is much more limited in scope, while her understanding of love is far more expansive. Friedan is far more concerned with power and control, or rather, what she calls "the power of love" or "the power of friendship." Friedan is also concerned with women's powerlessness within "the masculine" (which is
paraphrase:
Today marks the final day of our discussion on Betty Friedan's groundbreaking book, The Feminine Mystique. Join us at 3pm for a live chat and follow the conversation on Twitter using the hashtag #newmystique.
Friedan's work delves into the realms of psychology, particularly female psychology, and explores the concept of power (and its misuse) in society. She is preoccupied with the "feminine mystique," a term she uses to describe any theory or philosophy that perpetuates the notion that women are in need of more power to feel fully human.
Friedan's concerns extend beyond individual women, instead focusing on the collective sense of powerlessness among women within relationships, whether with men or other women. This is similar to her understanding of love, which she sees as inherently linked to power and control, rather than the love itself. While Friedan's scope is narrower than Freud's, her emphasis on women's powerlessness is more limited, while his understanding of love is more expansive.
Friedan is particularly attuned to the power dynamics within "the masculine" and the ways in which women are marginalized within these structures. By examining these dynamics, Friedan sheds light on the ways in which power operates to maintain gender inequality.

input:
What Happened in Cockpit of Flight 370?
Former accident investigator Steven Wallace speaks to circumstances if flight path was pre-programmed into the computer.
The pilot and first officer of the missing plane, both of them Malaysian, have come under
continuation:
scrutiny for possible failures in communications with air traffic control. Investigators are looking into whether this was intentional or just human error.
Host Frank Stasio spoke with former accident investigator Steven Wallace. Wallace is a professor of accident reconstruction and investigation at George Washington University.
Related: Investigators are looking into whether flight controllers had any "obvious, unusual" or "obvious" failures in communication with pilot. The flight control computer was switched off when the plane left Malaysia and was never switched back on. The control was manually turned back on. It was also switched off at 3:40 p.m. ET. The control was switched off before the plane left Malaysia.
Here is his report.
Follow Frank Stasio, Business Insiders Washington correspondent, @frankstasio, @cbsnewsradio, @businessinsider, @cbsnews, @businessinsider, @CNN, @CNNBreaking, @FoxNews, @FoxNewsLife, @CNBC, @cnn, @NBCNews, @CNNMoney, @nytimes, @NYT, @NBC, @NBCNewsInternational, @NBCNewspaper, @NBCWashington, @CNNMoney, @CNBC, @cnn,
paraphrase:
What Occurred in the Cockpit of Flight 370?
Former accident investigator Steven Wallace discusses the possibility that the flight path was pre-programmed into the computer. The pilot and first officer of the missing plane, both Malaysian, are under scrutiny for potential failures in communications with air traffic control, with investigators looking into whether this was intentional or just human error.
Wallace, a professor of accident reconstruction and investigation at George Washington University, spoke with host Frank Stasio about the investigation. Stasio is a business correspondent for Business Insider and has reported on the disappearance of Flight 370 for various news outlets.
Investigators are examining whether flight controllers had any "obvious, unusual" or "obvious" failures in communication with the pilot. The flight control computer was switched off when the plane left Malaysia and was never switched back on, with the control manually turned back on. It was also switched off at 3:40 p.m. ET, before the plane left Malaysia.
Here is Wallace's report on the investigation.

input: Getting people to interact with others and upload content to a community-driven site enough may sound easy, but engagement doesnt happen automatically. It takes time and work, and much of the right formula is deduced through trial and error.
continuation:
A few of these basics are already evident in our latest video. We began with creating an animated video (a.k.a. storyboard), which is basically the beginning of any video content. The video doesnt just illustrate whats in the storyboard, it allows us to create animation sequences in a manner that will enhance the storyboard, and ultimately, our audiences, experience.

At this stage of our video journey, we didnt just want to show off some of our storyboard animations, we also needed to test them. We needed to get user feedback from them in order to determine what could be improved, what could change, or whether or not they were okay. We also needed them to provide ideas, share content, and create a voiceover (well talk more about this in the next video, where we will talk about why this is even necessary, and also why its important to communicate with user voiceover talent.

With user voiceover talent, it is important to find someone with experience working with animations, storytelling, storyboarding, and voiceover talent. We found our voiceover talent in Lauren Hall, a talent manager with
paraphrase:
To foster meaningful interactions and user-generated content on our community-driven platform, it's important to recognize that engagement doesn't happen instantly. It requires time and effort, and we've found that the right formula is often discovered through a process of trial and error.
In our latest video, we've incorporated some fundamental elements that are already evident in the storyboard. By creating an animated video (or storyboard), we're able to bring the story to life in a way that enhances the audience's experience.
At this stage of the video production process, we didn't just want to showcase our animations; we also wanted to get user feedback to identify areas for improvement and to gather ideas for the content. We needed users to provide their input and share their voiceover talents to help us refine the final product.
To ensure the best possible outcome, we worked with Lauren Hall, a talent manager with expertise in animation, storytelling, and voiceover work. By collaborating with her, we were able to create a more polished and effective final product.

company.

Longe Sr. Mr. Longe joined the United States Navy in 1945. The couple plans to make their home in St. Louis. Mr. Longe is married to Mrs. Ann Murray, and he is also the president of The Murray Longe Company, which manufactures equipment, controls, and communications technology.

input:
Smoking rates in US have fallen to all-time low, but how did they ever get so high?
(THE CONVERSATION) The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention calls cigarette smoking the leading cause of preventable disease and death
continuation:
in the United States. The percentage of adults who smoke, while still rising, is at its lowest level in more than 30 years.
And yet, in 2016, more than 70 percent of all people who were born in America are estimated to have smoked  thats more than 200 million people. About 20 percent of these young adults are still smoking at least one cigarette a day, even if they have stopped. The CDCs own estimates indicate nearly 80,000 people die of smoking-related causes every year.
Although smoking rates in developed countries are dropping, in the United States smoking rates are growing  the first time in more than 50 years that rates are rising in this country, despite new laws, policies and education campaigns. Is this simply due to more people using more efficient and effective forms of tobacco, or is it more difficult for people to avoid smoking in public, which may encourage them to try other methods of smoking?
Part of the problem may stem from changing perceptions about smoking. For decades, smoking was associated with cancer, emphysema, emphysema-related diseases, coronary artery disease, lung cancer and other chronic diseases. It was associated with death. The more people smoked,
paraphrase:
The prevalence of smoking in the US has reached an all-time low, yet it is estimated that over 200 million people, including more than 70% of those born in America, have smoked at some point in their lives. Despite the decline in smoking rates, there is a worrying trend of smoking rates increasing in the US for the first time in over 50 years. This could be due to the emergence of more efficient and effective forms of tobacco or the difficulty in avoiding smoking in public places, leading some to turn to alternative smoking methods. However, changing attitudes towards smoking may also play a role, as it was once associated with cancer, respiratory diseases, and even death.
In contrast to the previous generation, who were aware of the health risks associated with smoking, younger people may be less aware or less concerned about the dangers of smoking. As a result, nearly 20% of young adults are still smoking daily, despite efforts to educate the public about the risks of smoking. Moreover, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), over 80,000 people succumb to smoking-related illnesses each year in the US.
While the decline in smoking rates in developed countries is encouraging, the increase in smoking rates in the US is a cause for concern. It highlights the need for continued education and awareness campaigns to prevent young people from taking up smoking and to encourage those who have already started to quit.

input:
Is a custom mouthpiece worth it?
Discussion in 'Standup Technique' started by ForeverFiending, May 4, 2008.
I was going to get a custom mouthgaurd for an upcoming MT fight, but one of my coaches said
continuation:
that I should just buy one. It was something like: "It's just one more mouthguard". I didn't want one, I didn't want to get one, why should I get one? Well, I already have a mouth guard. I already have plenty of them. I don't want something new, I just want to use something I already own. I think I could get away with getting one, I could get away with getting one.
Why get one if I already own one? Well, in this article, I will provide various reasons for why you should get one. Then, I'll provide reasons why you shouldn't get one. input:
China pledges "notable" emissions cut but some find lack of firm number disappointing.
But the leader of the world's biggest emitter dashed hopes that he would unveil a hard target to kickstart stalled climate talks due to be reconvened in
continuation:
Madrid in September.
Speaking at a forum in Beijing, Mr Xi said China would "make considerable progress" in 2030 when compared with previous emissions cuts.
But he also stressed that emissions in 2030 should be "near zero", meaning they will still need to peak before 2030.
Mr Xi also called for greater ambition from other countries, saying: "China stands ready to cooperate with them to build the next-generation international climate framework in support of green development."
At the same time, he urged countries to accelerate their shift to renewable energy in order to "create more stable, efficient, modern, and renewable energy."
China is expected to announce its first national action plan, which will cover 2023-2030, next year. Mr Xi said this will cover key sectors of the economy, such as power, transport and chemical industries.
Mr Xi stressed: "Achieving green growth will never be left in the hands of any one party, state or government, rather it will need to be jointly led, led from within, and led together."
With just 11 years left before the United Nations is expected to adopt a new deal setting guidelines for keeping global warming under 1.5 degrees, international negotiators are preparing to begin a
paraphrase: China has pledged to make notable emissions cuts, but some are disappointed by the lack of a specific target. Speaking at a forum in Beijing, President Xi expressed China's commitment to making considerable progress in 2030 compared to previous emissions cuts, while also emphasizing the importance of peaking emissions before 2030. Xi called for greater ambition from other countries and stressed the need for joint efforts to achieve green growth. China is expected to announce its first national action plan next year, covering key sectors of the economy such as power, transport, and chemical industries. Xi emphasized that achieving green growth cannot be left to any one party, state, or government, and must be led jointly and collectively. With just 11 years left before the UN is expected to adopt a new deal on global warming, international negotiators are preparing to begin negotiations on a new agreement.

input:
Ex-chief of general staff among more than 100 former officers accused of overthrowing government in 1997.
A former Turkish army chief has gone on trial in Ankara along with more than 100 other suspects for allegedly plotting to overthrow the Turkish government 16 years ago
continuation:
.
A prosecutor accused Colonel Zeki Celik, now 71, of aiding and abetting an armed struggle against Turkey, inciting riots and attempting to assassinate members of Turkeys ruling party.
Celik is accused of acting as a member of a terror organisation, aiding and abetting in terrorism, engaging in violent riots, organizing riots, and aiding and assisting in terrorism, according to CNN.
In court, Celik said he believed his military was acting in accordance with Islamic law.
I feel I was wrongly condemned, Celik said.
I think this was a legitimate action of the army, Celik said.
A total of 114 former members of the Turkish armed forces are charged with terrorism. The case will resume in court next week, according to Turkeys state-run news agency.
Turkeys military chief, General Hulusi Akar, was also named in the case.
In 2017, Akar was removed from his post by Turkish president Recep Tayyip Erdogan. He was later acquitted of the terrorism charge.
Erdogan accused Akar of betraying Turkey.
The traitor General was never charged. His name was not
paraphrase:
A former top military commander, Colonel Zeki Celik, has gone on trial in Ankara alongside over 100 other former officers, accused of plotting to overthrow the Turkish government in 1997. Celik, now 71, is charged with aiding and abetting an armed struggle against Turkey, inciting riots, and attempting to assassinate members of the ruling party. He claims he believed his actions were in line with Islamic law.
In court, Celik asserted his innocence, stating, "I feel I was wrongly condemned. I think this was a legitimate action of the army." A total of 114 former military members are charged with terrorism, and the case will resume next week, according to Turkeys state-run news agency.
Turkeys former military chief, General Hulusi Akar, was also named in the case. In 2017, Akar was removed from his post by Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and later acquitted of the terrorism charge. Erdogan accused Akar of betraying Turkey.
The trial comes amidst ongoing tensions between the government and the military, with some accusing the government of attempting to weaken the militarys power and influence. The case is expected to be a major test of Turkeys judicial system and its ability to handle sensitive political cases.

input: Looks like Apple wants a slice of the wearable camera action, based on recently awarded patents. The US Patents and Trademarks Office today awarded the iPhone maker a series of 34 patents, including one that details a GoPro-like action camera system.
continuation:
The new wearable camera technology will enable you to record, view, and share any action video using the iPhone, in any video format. Heres the full rundown:

A wearable camera system with a video processor, camera module, communication interface, and data storage for capturing action video. A video processor is responsive to input from the mobile device. The mobile device transmits video to the video processor. The video processor records action video using the action video. The video processor may receive audio information from the mobile device. The video processor may receive audio information from at least one of an audio receiver, audio speaker, microphone, accelerometer, gyro, barometric pressure, and/or ambient light. The video processor may receive information from the mobile device. The video processor may transmit information from the mobile device to the video processor. The video processor may receive information from the mobile device. The video processor may transmit information from the mobile device to the video processor. The video processor may transmit information from the mobile device to the video processor. A mobile device may transmit information from the mobile device. The mobile device may transmit information from the mobile device to the video processor. The mobile device may transmit information from the mobile device to the video processor
paraphrase:
Apple seems to be eyeing the wearable camera market, as evidenced by the recent patents awarded to the tech giant. According to the US Patents and Trademarks Office, Apple was granted 34 patents, including one for a GoPro-like action camera system. This innovative wearable technology will enable users to record, view, and share action videos seamlessly through their iPhone. Here's a detailed overview of the system:
A wearable camera system consisting of a video processor, camera module, communication interface, and data storage for capturing high-quality action footage. The video processor is designed to work in tandem with the iPhone, receiving input from the mobile device and transmitting video content back to it. The video processor can also record audio from the iPhone, accelerometer, gyro, barometric pressure, and ambient light, further enhancing the video quality. The video processor can transmit information to the iPhone, providing users with a seamless viewing experience. Additionally, the video processor can receive information from the iPhone, allowing for easy sharing of action videos on social media platforms. With this cutting-edge technology, users can now capture and share their action videos with ease, thanks to Apple's latest innovation.

input: The latest to join the growing list of independent fund managers is the Ex-Aureos Capital's India team, which has now teamed up to set up a $150-million Access India Advantages Fund to invest in mid-market oppoun
continuation:
ents.
"As part of Access India, we intend to invest in early-stage startups with the goal of creating a sustainable mid-market business in India with a revenue of over Rs 1,500 crore within the next five years," said the India-focused fund. "While India is an attractive destination in terms of talent, it is also a key market in terms of size, given its size compared to other regional economies. We will also look to invest in early-stage mid-market software service providers with technology platforms, which are expected to benefit from changing client behaviours and digital transformation."
As part of its Access India strategy, the fund will look to invest in startups with "a disruptive strategy, differentiated business models, rapid growth, with significant TAM, and innovative technologies". The fund will also look to invest in startups with "strong technology capabilities, disruptive technology, and growth opportunities". The fund will look at "growth through customer-centricity, while creating synergies with Access India".
Besides Ex-Aureos, Access India is currently backed by Sequoia India, LCH India, Exide Investments, IFC, TPG, I-T Fund Managers India, Nexus Venture Partners, Temasek,
paraphrase:
The latest addition to the growing list of independent fund managers is the former Ex-Aureos Capital India team, which has teamed up to launch a $150-million Access India Advantages Fund. This fund aims to invest in promising mid-market startups in India with a revenue target of over Rs 1,500 crore within the next five years.
According to the India-focused fund, the country offers a unique combination of talent and market size, making it an attractive investment destination. The fund plans to invest in early-stage startups with innovative technology platforms and disruptive business models, as well as mid-market software service providers with growth potential.
To identify potential investments, the fund will look for startups with a disruptive strategy, differentiated business models, rapid growth, and significant market opportunity. Additionally, the fund will prioritize investments in companies with strong technology capabilities, innovative technologies, and growth potential.
As part of its Access India strategy, the fund aims to create synergies with its backers, including Sequoia India, LCH India, Exide Investments, IFC, TPG, I-T Fund Managers India, Nexus Venture Partners, Temasek, and others. By leveraging these partnerships, the fund hopes to drive growth through customer-centricity and create value for its portfolio companies.

input:
THOUSAND OAKS, CA (RNN) - Less than two weeks after the Pittsburgh synagogue shooting that killed 11, another mass shooting has taken a dozen lives in California.
A gunman killed 12 people, including a sheriffs
continuation:
deputy, while he opened fire in a rural area of Thousand Oaks, California. The shooting happened Sunday evening around 7:00 p.m. local time. The wounded deputies were sent to a nearby hospital, where one is currently in stable condition. A second deputy was listed in serious, critical, or life-threatening condition. Authorities say multiple deputies are still in the hospital. The suspect was later found dead of what appear to be suicide. The identities of the shooter or shooters are unknown. Authorities are currently trying to determine whether the shooter was working alone or if he was working with others. Police say it appears to be an isolated incident.
In response, local elected officials, like Ventura County Sheriff Geoff Dean, released statements, expressing grief. The first responders, Sheriff Dean and Ventura County Fire Chief Brian Fennessy, are pleading with people to stay off the roads. The Ventura County Sheriffs office says local residents should avoid the area where the shooting took place. The Sheriffs office said this is a tragedy of significant magnitude. The Ventura County Sheriffs office, Ventura County Fire, Ventura Police Department, and other law enforcement agencies are working together in this joint
paraphrase:
Tragedy Strikes California as Gunman Kills 12 in Rural Area
Less than two weeks after the devastating synagogue shooting in Pittsburgh that claimed 11 lives, a mass shooting in California has left a dozen people dead, including a sheriff's deputy. The horrific incident occurred on Sunday evening in a rural area of Thousand Oaks, California, at around 7:00 p.m. local time. Two deputies were rushed to the hospital, with one currently in stable condition, while the second is listed in serious, critical, or life-threatening condition. Authorities are still investigating and are trying to determine if the shooter acted alone or in collaboration with others.
Local officials, including Ventura County Sheriff Geoff Dean, have released statements expressing their grief and sadness over the senseless act of violence. First responders, such as Sheriff Dean and Ventura County Fire Chief Brian Fennessy, are urging people to stay off the roads and avoid the area where the shooting took place. The Ventura County Sheriff's Office is working closely with other law enforcement agencies, including the Ventura County Fire Department, Ventura Police Department, and other local departments, to ensure the safety of the community.
This tragic event has shocked and saddened the entire community, and the Ventura County Sheriff's Office is working tirelessly to determine the motives behind the shooting and to bring justice to the victims and their families. The community is asked to remain vigilant and to report any suspicious activity to the authorities.
In summary, a gunman has killed 12 people, including a sheriff's deputy, in a rural area of Thousand Oaks, California, in what appears to be an isolated incident. Local officials are expressing grief and urging people to stay safe, while law enforcement agencies are working together to investigate the shooting and bring justice to the victims and their families.

input: My son Kris, an Army Ranger, was one of the first killed in action on October 19, 2001, in Operation Rhino, our first incursion into Afghanistan right after 9/11. Kris had been in Ranger School during that attack on American soil
continuation:
. The war was going just fine. We were in the process of closing the doors on the war, and when we did, it wasnt like it is in other countries. We were under the control of local Afghan government forces, which were not considered legitimate US military forces. Because of that, soldiers were dying in what we were supposed to be protecting, and it was costing us more money, more soldiers, more casualties. It was only when it became clear that it wasnt worth it any more, or that our current strategy was going nowhere, did we decide to withdraw. I remember going home with his mother, who was devastated. It was her baby. It was his baby. It was a young boy, in a young boys life. I remember getting in from deployment, going to see him, talking to him, crying. It was just like losing him all over again.

My son was in his early 20s when he was killed. He was in his first year of Ranger School, and just getting ready for his basic training, when he was killed. It wasnt like he was too far into his career, or in his career in general. He was
paraphrase: My son, Kris, was one of the initial casualties during the October 19, 2001, operation in Afghanistan, known as Operation Rhino. At the time, he was undergoing Ranger School training, which made the attack on American soil even more devastating. Despite the initial success of the war, the situation rapidly deteriorated as we faced mounting casualties and an increasingly dire financial situation. The fact that the local Afghan government forces, which we were relying on for support, were not considered legitimate US military forces only added to the sense of hopelessness. As the situation became more dire, we were forced to reassess our strategy and ultimately decide to withdraw. I still vividly recall the anguish I felt upon returning home with Kris's mother, who was heartbroken at the loss of her child. It was a painful reminder of the ultimate cost of war. Kris was in his early twenties at the time of his death, just starting his career as a Ranger. It was a tragic loss of potential, and a sobering reminder of the fragility of life.
